title: Systems Engineer
description: Ku-Band SATCOM subject matter expert for integrating, testing, technical writing, training, and engineering support of 1.5M, 2.0M, and 4.9M commercial VSAT systems used on various government fixed, transportable, and mobile platforms for Navy Air Systems Command Special Communications Requirements Division (NAVAIR SCRD). Wrote the E-6 Mercury Command, Control, Communications, Computer, and Intelligence (C4I) Support Plan. Developed the event trace timeline depictions, Technical Architecture Views, and extended E-6 System and Operational Information Exchange Requirements (IER) tables used in the E-6B Mercury C4I Support Plan. Developed E-6B operational views, system views, and roll-up IER table used in the E-6 Mercury Operational Requirements Document.

title: Deployable Communications System Manager
company: HQ Air Commbat Command Directorate of Communications & Information
description: Managed logistic support activities for acquisition, fielding, sustainment and disposition of tactical Super High Frequency and Ultra High Frequency SATCOM systems. Developed the fielding plan for the AN/PSC-5, Spitfire UHF DAMA SATCOM radio to the Pacific Air Forces Command, European Air Forces Command, Air National Guard. Project manager for the Langley AFB, REACHBACK SATCOM teleport facility supporting ACC logistics communications and transactions to forward deployed forces.

title: SATCOM Logistics Management Specialist
company: USAF HQ Air Force Command, Control, Communications and Computers Agency (AFC4A)
description: Managed the integrated logistic support (ILS) activities for acquisition, fielding, sustainment, testing and disposition of Air Force Defense Satellite Communications Systems (DSCS) Heavy and Medium sized SATCOM terminals. Maintained and updated ILS plans for the AF DSCS Jam Resistant Secure Communications (JRSC) program office. Interfaced with AF depot logistics managers to determine disposition of spares and test equipment as well as developing and resolving spares and test equipment requirements supporting AF DSCS terminals on a daily bases.

Responsible for leading, mentoring, training, and motivating nine soldiers, while maintaining responsibility for the coordination and implementation of communications circuit paths on three satellite terminals (AN/GSC-52), two Military Strategic and Tactical Relay (MILSTAR) Command Post Terminals (AN/FRC-181), four Satellite Communications Sets (AN/USC-28 terminals), three Promina 800 nodes, one Broadband Systems 8000 node, one Timplex Link2+ node, and one AN/USC-66 (MIDAS). Also responsible for safeguarding all Non-secure Internet Protocol Routing (NIPR) and Secure Internet Protocol Routing (SIPR) trunks, over thirty Enhanced Bandwidth Efficient Modems (EBEM’s), and all associated Communications Security (COMSEC) devices and Cryptographic items valued at over $55 million in constant readiness for direct support of the President of the United States, Secretary of Defense, and Combatant Commanders. Areas of special emphasis include: White House Communications Agency (WHCA), National Airborne Operations Center (NAOC), and Ground Mobile Forces (GMF) Mission Operations. I have constant interaction and knowledge on Spread Spectrum Multiple Access (SSMA) Operations; Frequency Division Multiple Access (FDMA); Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA).

title: Certified Operator
description: Served as soldier-in-training learning skills valued by; such as leadership, confidence, loyalty, duty, respect, selfless service, honor, integrity, and personal courage. Learned skills in Basic Training such as organization, communication, combat-readiness, weapons training, hand-to-hand combat, physical fitness, and Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation. Acquired technical knowledge in Advanced Individualized Training pertaining to Satellite Communications such as: signal flow, modems, routers, Up Converters (U/C), Down Converters (D/C), High Power Amplifiers (HPA), and electrical theory. RELATED SKILLS AND; and Organizational level maintenance technician of a MILSTAR Command Post terminal for multiple secure voice and data networks. Successful graduate of the US Army Professional Leadership Development Course (PLDC); and the Air Force MILSTAR Maintenance/Operator Course. Supervised and taught others in the theory and correct operation of the MILSTAR Command Post terminal. Assembled, supervised, coached, and evaluated the construction and grading of several technicians and the SATCOM site certification packets required for proficiency evaluation. Proficient in the handling, loading, receiving, transportation, and destruction of Department of Defense secure cryptographic material. Progressive history of taking on more responsibility and accomplishing assigned tasks; while meeting short time standards and exceeding expectations. TRAINING/CERTIFICATIONS: Active Secret Clearance MILSTAR Operations and Maintenance/ MILSTAR Command Post Operator MIDAS DoD Information Assurance Awareness Switch Multiplexing Unit (SMU) Standardized Tactical Entry Point (STEP) Systems Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)

summary: -At my current position, I help the sales team design and price working networks for Customers to utilize to help better their Companies. -At my previous position, I designed, built, and implement Networking Solutions for the New England Area. -Former Satellite Communication Operator/Maintainer in the Army who was responsible for $50-$70 million dollars worth of equipment. -Active Security Clearance. -Knowledgeable in the area of Wireless and Radio Frequency. -My experience in the military gave me the ability to build, troubleshoot, and monitor WANs/LANs on a Global scale. -My greatest achievement so far, would be helping to alleviate the telephonic network in Japan for the Fukushima disaster!

title: Series 0391-GS-12 Telecommunications Specialist
description: Serves as Telecommunications Specialist with the NETCOM G33/Incident Handler for Army Cyber (ARCYBER) Operations and Integration Center (ACOIC). Provides real time situational awareness of events/incidents necessary to maintain an accurate operational picture of the ARCYBER area of responsibility (AOR). Provides incident response services in support of Army Cyber Command and the Network Enterprise and Technology Command (NETCOM) including managing complex tracking and data analysis tasks in order to identify computer attacks and probes as they occur. Provides expert authority for the respective network management, service provisioning, basic transmission, satellite transmission communications, applications, information assurance, or transport systems, voice, data, or video equipment or systems, or optical mesh networking and Internet protocol routing security criteria, methodologies, techniques, processes, and mechanisms. USCYBERCOM and other Department of Defense (DoD) components. Tracks and reports network operation events (NIPRNet/SIPIRNet/DSN/DOD DISA Enterprise Email outages or Authorize Service Interruptions (ASI)) affecting the U.S. Army's portion of the Global Information Grid via Remedy tacking system. Coordinates with Theater Network Operations and Security Centers (TNOSCs) on outages, spillages, cross domain violations and other NETOPS related issue to ensure adherence to proper procedures and guidelines. Produces daily Situational Awareness Report (SAR) , Commander Army Cyber Command Strategic Critical Information Requirement (CCIR) reports, and briefings to U.S. Army senior leadership (Colonial level up to a Three-Star level) on network operation events affecting the U.S. Army's portion of the Global Information Grid. Tracks, documents, and coordinates clean-up of unauthorized disclosure of classified information (UDCI) between U.S. Army organizations and government agencies.

title: Communications Specialist 3
description: Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) Tier II Engineer responsible for providing functional guidance, supervision, technical support, training and quality assurance/quality control to Level I personnel. Performs network analysis for problem areas and trends to isolate issues before they become service-affecting impairments or outages and to ensure services meet the specified service level agreement. Coordinate with contractors, vendors, and customers to schedule system downtimes for Authorized Service Interruptions (ASIs) policies. Coordinate with both government agencies and commercial vendors to schedule installations of hardware, hardware upgrades, or removal of equipment. Perform software upgrade on ATM related equipment. Perform DISN Asynchronous Transfer Mode Services (DATMS) Tier II Trunk/Circuit Implementation. Work closely with customers to active, upgrade, modify, cutover, or discontinue customer access circuits, customer access trunks and backbone trunks, ranging in size of 64 KB up to OC-48. Work with the ADTECH test equipment and servers. Responsible for building test paths throughout the network for Tier I and II to perform testing and troubleshooting. Responsible for DATMS Consolidation End of Month Reports and DATMS Month Availability & Reliability Reports that tracks the ATM Fabrics, Backbone Trunks, Edge Devices, ATM Network and Customer Access Circuits. Troubleshoot trunks/circuits that ride over ATM; Secure Internet Protocol Router network(SIPRNET), Non-Secure Internet Protocol Router network (NIPRNET), Promina, video, data, and voice. Provides in-depth and high level, telephone support to end-user community on hardware, software and network related problems, questions, and uses. Provides problem resolution via the telephone with users/customers. Troubleshoot with customers, commercial vendors & other technologies (IP, SONET, PROMINA, and Satellite Communications) to isolate and correct communication issues.

title: ATM/Promina Network Controller Level II
description: Serves as Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM)/Promina Network Controller/Operator II technical specialist responsible for the monitoring, operating and managing of the ATM and Promina Defense Information System Network and Global Information Grid network equipment. Responsible for providing help desk support to end-users and customers. Provides in-depth and high level, telephone support to end-user community on hardware, software and network related problems, questions, and uses. Provides problem resolution via the telephone with users/customers. Walks the customer through a series of troubleshooting steps to determine the problem. Creates, tracks, and closes DISA Trouble Management System (TMS) trouble tickets; ensures problem ownership and promotes end-user satisfaction. Tracks activities of field engineers to who tickets were assigned. Troubleshoot with customers, commercial vendors and other technologies (IP, SONET, PROMINA, and Satellite Communications) to isolate and correct communication issues. Troubleshoot trunks/circuits that ride over ATM and Promina; Secure Internet Protocol Router network (SIPRNet), Non-Secure Internet Protocol Router network (NIPRNet), Video data, and voice. Assist satellite terminal and end users with Promina and ATM interface network issues. Set-up and troubleshoot Satellite Earth Terminal Standard Tactical Entry Point (STEP)/Ground Mobile Force (GMF) Promina circuits with the satellite terminal and end-user. Provides functional guidance, technical support, training, and quality assurance/quality control to Level I personnel.

title: SATCOM Assistant Site Supervisor/STEP Coordinator
description: Supervises, plans, and directs the installation, operation, and maintenance of newly built AN/GSC-39D Satellite Earth Terminal with Standard Tactical Entry Point (STEP) gateways, two Promina STEP Nodes, and Switch Multiplexer Unit (SMU-96). Repaired, installed, aligned, and tested Fiber Optic Modems, Multiplexers, Crypto, Modems, Up/Down Converters, High Power Amplifiers, Power Generators, and Antennas. Time Division Multiplexers (low-rate multiplexers, and T1 and up), Phase Shift Keying (PSK). Fiber optic modems, computer control systems, cryogenically-cooled amplifiers, solid state amplifiers, high power transmitters (Traveling wave and Klystron), remote earth terminal control equipment, Stratum I and II timing sources, mechanical support systems (air-conditioning, servos, synchros, simple hydraulics, tracking systems, uninterruptible power supplies(UPS), generators, and nitrogen pressurize waveguide systems. Experienced using test equipment to include Network Analyzers, Spectrum Analyzers, Oscilloscopes, Power Meters, Frequency Counters, Signal Generators, Multi-meter test equipment, and optical time-domain reflectometer (OTDR). Provides technical advice to commanders and tactically users requiring interface access to CENTCOM, DISA, or satellite assets. Develops and ensures compliance with policy and procedures for all types of satellite operational environments. Determines capabilities and limitations of assigned equipment. . Establishes written day-to-day operations and maintenance procedures. Develops and implements 90-day job certification program for newly assigned personnel and shift supervisors. Reviews, analyzes, and resolves telecommunication problems using sound evaluation concepts and practices. Coordinates the activation of new circuits, links, and trunks accessing the satellite communication facility. Coordinates with operational elements of external organizations to resolve conflicts in existing or future mission requirements.

title: Advance Non-Commissioned Officer Small Group Leader
company: U.S. Army Regimental Non-Commissioned Officer Academy (NCOA)
description: Responsible for the professional development and training of Senior Noncommissioned Officers attending the Advance Non-Commissioned Officer Course (ANCOC). Instructs Stand Alone Common Core Training courses (phase I, two-week course). Major subject areas taught include Leadership, Communication Skills, Counseling, Training Management, and Military Decision Making Process with emphasis upon the role of the battalion S6, Combat Net Radio Operations, and Plans, Orders, Annexes. Serves as primary instructor and Subject-Matter-Expert (SME) for ANCOC 31S4O/31P4O Satellite/Microwave System Chief Course Phase II. Teaches MOS specific technical training courses for 31S40/31P40 Satellite/Microwave System Chief (phase II, 12 week Course). Major subject areas include Satellite Communications and Technical Facilities Site Administration, Strategic Signal Operations, Satellite Communication Systems, Site Operations, and Tactical Signal Operations.

title: Tactical Operations Manager/Platoon Sergeant
description: Plans, coordinates and deploys a Tactical Satellite Company in support of Echelons Above Corps consisting of 92 soldiers, four AN/TSC-85 and eight AN/TSC-93 tactical satellite terminals, 54 vehicles and 32 power generation units. Coordination with Army, Joint Services, and commercial activities to provided satellite communication support to all levels of command. Provides satellite technical advice to commanders and supports the Battalion S3/S6 during Field Training Exercises. Troubleshoots satellite communication related issues over the phone with satellite controller station, satellite communication terminals, end-users, and other affected technologies in support of Battalion S3/S6 training missions. Conducts After Action Reviews to determine the effectiveness of troubleshooting satellite communication problems, training effectiveness, and document lessons learned. Reviews, analyzes, and resolves telecommunication problems using sound evaluation concepts and practices. Develops and ensures compliance with policy and procedures for all types of satellite operational environments. Prepares and submit reports on all circuits in the terminal to include Satellite Access Request (SAR) and Gateway Access Request (GAR).

title: SATCOM Station Manager
company: U.S. Army Echo Company, 1110th SIG BN.,
description: Supervises, plans, and directs the installation, operation, and maintenance of 3 AN/GSC-52 Satellite Terminals, 2 AN/FRC-181 MILSTAR Satellite Terminals, 4 AN/USC-28 Spread Spectrum Modem, 2 IDNX nodes, and 3 STEP gateways. Repaired, replace, installed, aligned, and tested fiber optic modems, multiplexers, crypto equipment, satellite modems, up/down converters, high power amplifiers (solid state amplifier, traveling wave tube and klystron tube), low noise amplifiers, computer control systems, solid state amplifiers, remote earth terminal control equipment, Electronic-Counter-Counter-Measures (ECCM) systems, Stratum I and II timing sources, mechanical support systems (air-conditioning, servos, synchros, simple hydraulics, Helium gas cooling, and heat exchangers), tracking systems, nitrogen pressurize waveguide systems, antenna, uninterruptible power supplies(UPS), and power generators. Experienced using test equipment to include Network Analyzers, Spectrum Analyzers, Oscilloscopes, Power Meters, Frequency Counters, Signal Generators, Multi-meter test equipment, and optical time-domain reflectometer (OTDR). Develops and ensures compliance with policy and procedures for all types of satellite operational environments. Determines capabilities and limitations of assigned equipment. Conducts technical evaluations of equipment and facilities. Establishes workload, work schedules, and maintenance priorities. Trains subordinate personnel in the operation and maintenance of satellite and associated equipment. Reviews, analyzes, and resolves telecommunication problems using sound evaluation concepts and practices. Ordered and tracked PLL repair parts. Performed quality control tests on circuits, trunk groups, systems, and preventive maintenance checks on assigned communication equipment, vehicles, and power generators. Served as site test, measurement, and diagnostic equipment (TMDE) coordinator.

title: SATCOM Operation/Maintenance NCO
company: U.S. Army Echo Company, 1110th SIG BN
description: Responsible for the operations and maintenance of an AN/FSC-78 strategic satellite communications terminal. Repaired, replace, installed, aligned, and tested fiber optic modems, multiplexers, crypto equipment, satellite modems, up/down converters, high power amplifiers (solid state amplifier, low noise amplifiers, computer control systems, cryogenically-cooled amplifiers, solid state amplifiers, remote earth terminal control equipment, Stratum I and II timing sources, mechanical support systems (air-conditioning, servos, synchros, simple hydraulics, tracking systems, nitrogen pressurize waveguide systems, antenna, uninterruptible power supplies(UPS), and power generators. Experienced using test equipment to include Network Analyzers, Spectrum Analyzers, Oscilloscopes, Power Meters, Frequency Counters. Established facility maintenance procedures and maintain maintenance records. Developed and implemented 90-day job certification program for new personnel and shift supervisors. Coordinated and scheduled PMCS on assigned equipment and maintenance downtime with local users, distant ends, and DISA. Conveys changes to procedures, systems, equipment, and operational/technical requirements to coworkers. Identifies deficiencies, recommendations, and implements facility procedural enhancements, while maintaining safety. Maintains telecommunication and satellite system knowledge, and assists with software design and implementation. Monitors repair of equipment and perform quality assurance inspections. Verifies performance of scheduled preventive maintenance actions, analyzes results, and implements corrective actions. Evaluates procedures and equipment and submits documentation for modification or redesign. Performed quality control tests on circuits, trunk groups, systems, and preventive maintenance checks on assigned communication equipment, vehicles, and power generators. Managed, mentored, trained, counseled subordinate Satellite Equipment Repairers.

title: SATCOM Operation/Maintenance NCO
company: US Army 39th Signal Battalion, 128th Signal Company
description: Supervises, plans, and directs the installation, operation, and maintenance of 3 AN/GSC-52 Satellite Terminals, 2 AN/FRC-181 MILSTAR Satellite Terminals, 4 AN/USC-28 Spread Spectrum Modem, 2 IDNX nodes, and 3 STEP gateways. Repaired, replace, installed, aligned, and tested fiber optic modems, multiplexers, crypto equipment, satellite modems, up/down converters, high power amplifiers (solid state amplifier, traveling wave tube and klystron tube), low noise amplifiers, computer control systems, solid state amplifiers, remote earth terminal control equipment, Electronic-Counter-Counter-Measures (ECCM) systems, Stratum I and II timing sources, mechanical support systems (air-conditioning, servos, synchros, simple hydraulics, Helium gas cooling, and heat exchangers), tracking systems, nitrogen pressurize waveguide systems, antenna, uninterruptible power supplies(UPS), and power generators. Experienced using test equipment to include Network Analyzers, Spectrum Analyzers, Oscilloscopes, Power Meters, Frequency Counters, Signal Generators, Multi-meter test equipment, and optical time-domain reflectometer (OTDR). Develops and ensures compliance with policy and procedures for all types of satellite operational environments. Determines capabilities and limitations of assigned equipment. Conducts technical evaluations of equipment and facilities. Establishes workload, work schedules, and maintenance priorities. Trains subordinate personnel in the operation and maintenance of satellite and associated equipment. Reviews, analyzes, and resolves telecommunication problems using sound evaluation concepts and practices. Ordered and tracked PLL repair parts. Performed quality control tests on circuits, trunk groups, systems, and preventive maintenance checks on assigned communication equipment, vehicles, and power generators. Served as site test, measurement, and diagnostic equipment (TMDE) coordinator.

title: Maintenance Officer
description: Provides global information services to enable Battle Command from the US President to federal agencies.; Led, mentored, supervised and trained 24 personnel in routine, special and emergency maintenance of strategic satellite, command and counter-measure communication terminals and transponder injection systems, and associated diagnostic equipment, valued in excess of $53M, in support of the US President, Joint Chiefs of Staff, National Military Command Center and Combatant Commanders; scheduled and reported SATCOM equipment maintenance. Competed against more than 20 service members in job performance, leadership abilities, and technical skills; selected as Fort Belvoir Non-Commissioned Officer (NCO), Company NCO, Battalion NCO and Brigade NCO during 3rd and 4th quarter 2007. Outperformed 80 peers attending Warrior Leaders Course; earned Distinguished Honor Graduate for maintaining highest test average and leadership demonstration. Established standard operating procedures on SATCOM equipment maintenance served as primary instructor for maintenance training; trained 40+ service members ensuring overall reliability of communication delivered to Dept. of Defense.

title: SATCOM Technician
description: •Perform duties as a Satellite Communications Technician for a Media Gateway and Global Information Grid facility consisting of a Defense Satellite Communications Systems facility, Primary Technical Control Group, and a TROJAN Network Control Center that provide support to the Office of the President of the United States, White House Communications Agency, National Airborne Operations Center, Secretary of Defense, Department of Defense, Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS), Unified Combatant Commanders, Intelligence Community, and other federal agencies with 24 hour world-wide command, control, communications, and intelligence. •Monitored phone lines and worked in depth with thousands of customers over the phone on issues with equipment and connectivity issues to ensure their links have the least interruptions and reduced down times as much as possible by resolving and troubleshooting problems. •Highly skilled in maintaining, repairing, and troubleshooting while insuring the continuous movement of voice and data communications from one location to another via such major communications networks as Defense Satellite Communications System Satellite Trunks, Ground Mobile Forces missions, White House Communications Agency missions, National Airborne Operations Center missions, Spread Spectrum Multiple Access missions and communications utilizing the AN/USC-28 modem, and complex circuits and systems. •Perform link restoral procedures and outage reporting systems within the Satellite Communications Facility, Technical Control Group according to DISA, Defense Dissemination System, and the 302nd Signal Battalion standards and ensured that all resources were properly supervised, trained, and utilized in support of 100% task coverage of operational and maintenance activities.

title: President and General Manager
description: Founded Knight Sky as a satellite and wireless consultancy for military communications. Expanded the business into software development, systems integration and managed network services. With no outside investment I grew the business from zero to $5 Million in annual revenue while establishing a strong reputation of technical expertise, quality service and business integrity. Prime Contracts: GSA Satcom II Small Business, GSA Schedule 70, Top Secret Facilities Clearance, Virginia Broadband Services Contract Subcontracts: ITES-2S, Comets II, CEAT II, S3, Eagle Strategic Partnerships and Alliances: iDirect Technologies, Viasat Technologies, CISCO Systems Government Solutions Group, General Dynamics, Customers: US Army - PEO EIS, National Guard Bureau (NGB-J6 ), Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA), Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), National Oceanographic Atmospheric Agency (NOAA), United States Forest Service (USFS), Telecommunication Systems (TCS), Global Communication Systems (GCS)

title: Manager Business Development - Europe
description: I was originally hired at COMSAT Laboratories as Manager of the Image Processing Department which is a fancy name for the DVB satellite products group. I have several extremely brilliant people working with me developing MPEG-2 Encoders, decoders and multiplexer products. The Wegner communication product line was designed by my team, as well as the first video encoder for the DARPA Predator UAV project. As the Labs transitioned to a for profit business, I was asked to perform business development for the newly released Linkway 2000 product line. Consequently I won and managed the first two major Linkway networks.

title: SharePoint Developer / Knowledge Management
description: Provide assistance to the NAVSEA 05 Division in the use of current KM tools including iNAVY, CDMS, and Shared Drives. Create documentation to assist NAVSEA users in best practices of using KM tools to collaborate, archive, and release information to the proper audiences and to assist division operations for SEA05 and the external iNAVY community. Assist the iNAVY groups in the creation of secure workspaces to conduct daily operations. Provide a clear toolset to each group based on a groups established requirements. Enable each group Site Administrator and Division Contact on ease of use for iNAVY to support the collaboration and release of information to support division needs. The KM team will provide a Knowledge Management support structure with simple and easy to understand guidelines and face to face interaction with each groups POC’s. Conduct meetings on the proper use of tools and working with artifacts in an evolving working environment. The team will introduce new concepts of knowledge sharing and tagging with use of key terms for retrieving information. The key terms will be based on group input, tasks, and artifact creation. The KM team will also work with each division on the clean-up of KM Tools including the archival and retrieval of information on shared drives and decommissioned iNAVY Portals. They will also assist in the migration of information on NAVSEA Shared Drives to the proper repositories and create strategies to work with all KM tools in the NAVSEA Environment.

title: SharePoint Administrator / Knowledge Management
description: As part of the Knowledge Management (KM) Team we are responsible for the day to day operation of the Portal, the Portal Support Desk functions, requirements development, and content management. As a Content Managers we compose the requirements supporting our assigned user community and Power Users in development site by understanding the critical elements required of our assigned user community to complete their mission. The Content Managers will translate the Users' site development and change request into diagrams and web page/part mock ups to increase the Knowledge Management Team's understanding of the User requirements. Content Manager's are also responsible for maintenance of content within an assigned user community. We ensure that published content is kept up to date, that sensitive information is secured as necessary, and that content is archived in keeping with Army Records Management policies. The Content Managers will also conduct a weekly review of the permissions of the groups assigned to them to ensure that they are properly set, to ensure adherence with privacy policies. The Content Manager's provide a User's perspective to the Portal Government Lead and KM Team lead on requirements.

summary: Highly dynamic, innovative, and results-oriented professional, with broad-based experience and hands-on skills in equipment operations, succession planning and execution, regulatory compliance, and site management. Equipped with proven skills in diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving technical problems and delivering solutions that consistently meet corporate objectives. Adept at fostering a positive environment by utilizing excellent communication and interpersonal aptitude. Effective in handling and completing various tasks simultaneously without compromising quality of service. Exemplify solid customer relation expertise with an inherent sense of empathy in understanding and dealing with the needs and desires of people of diverse cultures and backgrounds. Accomplished in identifying and resolving complex communications outages, utilizing systematic troubleshooting methods. Currently hold an Active DoD Top Secret Clearance.

title: Technical Training Manager
description: •Participate in the daily meeting to resolve issues and reports on technical problems through comprehensive review and analysis to identify knowledge gaps in technicians; recommend training topics to platoon sergeants. •Construct quarterly schedule of training programs and designate trainers for 4 shifts of 12 technicians in a rotating schedule; administer schedule of individual staff, including vacations, schools, and other mandatory company events to ensure minimum manning requirement mandated by DISA. •Guarantee proper training of new technicians regarding unique satellite communications site and system to achieve their maximum potential in just 90 days upon arrival in the unit. •Reconstruct an outdated site certification process; take responsibility in writing knowledge and skills requirements for the system and common task and assessment measures, including exercise scenarios, job aids, training aids, and online blackboard exams. •Perform in-depth research of all systems to maintain accuracy in training and common technician knowledge. •Coordinate with outside agencies, distant end customers, and sister SATCOM sites to organize training exercises in order to provide realistic training support and opportunities for high-priority links and systems. •Secure the proper flow of communications equipment that directly supports White House Communications Agency, National Airborne Operations Center, and Combatant Commanders.

title: Safety Program Manager
description: •Presided over the Army safety program and OSHA compliance of workplace safety including duty safety education. •Performed monthly inspections and walk-through for the entire site to maintain safety compliance; sustained all safety-related documentation and records. •Reviewed and provided recommendations in executing safe mission operations to the company commander. •Secured that risk management was properly incorporated into all planning. •Ensured completion of the quarterly training in a proper and timely manner. •Coordinated with the Police, Fire Department, and Public Health to provide expert training on safety arena to the entire company; educated and coached on numerous safety-related classes. •Carried out extensive research in OHSA regulations, army regulations, and general safety practices to improve present regulations and perform corrections. •Assumed full accountability in executing annual comprehensive inspection; increased safety inspection score by 25%. •Handled the maintenance of functional inventory of personal protective equipment and other safety supplies. •Conducted investigation on workplace and off duty accidents.

title: Standardized Tactical Entry Point (STEP) Planner
description: •Designated individual equipment to specific short-term access customer, complying with the guidelines published in the SAA and GAA. •Played a pivotal role in implementing accessibility of packets for easy use among technicians to set up tactical and naval user access missions through PowerPoint and Visio to create network diagrams, establish and tear-down checklists, and modem setting cutsheets. •Developed similar system for authorized service interruptions that abolished notification failures and eliminated huge problem in the communication system to maintain the availability of the Internet and phone services. •Maintained up-to-dateness of system through listing equipment and their MIDAS (digital patch panel). •Kept abreast of device both used in missions and under maintenance; monitored permanent links used. •Managed mission-related issues; handled changes, cancellations, and modifications by monitoring the SIPRnet for messages. •Guaranteed the quality of technical log entries and made certain that all troubleshooting steps were documented. •Assessed accuracy on all action reviews by ensuring proper documentation of log, fix actions and downtime before sending to the higher echelons.

title: Action Request Center (Helpdesk) Specialist
company: South Theater Network Operations and Security Center
description: •Facilitated activities in the BMC remedy service desk toolset as well as tracked and documented all remedy incident tickets. •Served as the terminal server access control system (TSACS) service manager responsible in rendering support to 741 service providers by coordinating with the technical support and providing troubleshooting assistance to users with communications problems. •Scrutinized diverse real-world circuits on the integrated network management system and SolarWinds along with the security on the intrusion detection system. •Created and compiled precise reports of different organizations through the Department of Defense on a daily, monthly and quarterly basis. •Managed the authorized service interruptions in the South Eastern United States, Central America, South America, and Caribbean Islands. •Assessed and attended to numerous requests for repairs from troubleshooting equipment to receiving and passing reports of critical outages. •Assumed lead role over the operational team in the absence of the supervisor by accomplishing assignments without direction, preparing facility for visitors, and monitoring facility work orders. •Took charge of presenting video teleconference briefings and tours to visitors such as VIPs, gaining favorable comments and accolades for superb performance.

title: Technical Training Manager
description: •Participate in the daily meeting to resolve issues and reports on technical problems through comprehensive review and analysis to identify knowledge gaps in technicians; recommend training topics to platoon sergeants. •Construct quarterly schedule of training programs and designate trainers for 4 shifts of 12 technicians in a rotating schedule; administer schedule of individual staff, including vacations, schools, and other mandatory company events to ensure minimum manning requirement mandated by DISA. •Guarantee proper training of new technicians regarding unique satellite communications site and system to achieve their maximum potential in just 90 days upon arrival in the unit. •Reconstruct an outdated site certification process; take responsibility in writing knowledge and skills requirements for the system and common task and assessment measures, including exercise scenarios, job aids, training aids, and online blackboard exams. •Perform in-depth research of all systems to maintain accuracy in training and common technician knowledge. •Coordinate with outside agencies, distant end customers, and sister SATCOM sites to organize training exercises in order to provide realistic training support and opportunities for high-priority links and systems. •Secure the proper flow of communications equipment that directly supports White House Communications Agency, National Airborne Operations Center, and Combatant Commanders.

title: Safety Program Manager
description: •Presided over the Army safety program and OSHA compliance of workplace safety including duty safety education. •Performed monthly inspections and walk-through for the entire site to maintain safety compliance; sustained all safety-related documentation and records. •Reviewed and provided recommendations in executing safe mission operations to the company commander. •Secured that risk management was properly incorporated into all planning. •Ensured completion of the quarterly training in a proper and timely manner. •Coordinated with the Police, Fire Department, and Public Health to provide expert training on safety arena to the entire company; educated and coached on numerous safety-related classes. •Carried out extensive research in OHSA regulations, army regulations, and general safety practices to improve present regulations and perform corrections. •Assumed full accountability in executing annual comprehensive inspection; increased safety inspection score by 25%. •Handled the maintenance of functional inventory of personal protective equipment and other safety supplies. •Conducted investigation on workplace and off duty accidents.

summary: Highly dynamic, innovative, and results-oriented professional, with broad-based experience and hands-on skills in equipment operations, succession planning and execution, regulatory compliance, and site management. Equipped with proven skills in diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving technical problems and delivering solutions that consistently meet corporate objectives. Adept at fostering a positive environment by utilizing excellent communication and interpersonal aptitude. Effective in handling and completing various tasks simultaneously without compromising quality of service. Exemplify solid customer relation expertise with an inherent sense of empathy in understanding and dealing with the needs and desires of people of diverse cultures and backgrounds. Accomplished in identifying and resolving complex communications outages, utilizing systematic troubleshooting methods. Currently hold an Active DoD Top Secret Clearance.

title: Standardized Tactical Entry Point (STEP) Planner
description: •Designated individual equipment to specific short-term access customer, complying with the guidelines published in the SAA and GAA. •Played a pivotal role in implementing accessibility of packets for easy use among technicians to set up tactical and naval user access missions through PowerPoint and Visio to create network diagrams, establish and tear-down checklists, and modem setting cutsheets. •Developed similar system for authorized service interruptions that abolished notification failures and eliminated huge problem in the communication system to maintain the availability of the Internet and phone services. •Maintained up-to-dateness of system through listing equipment and their MIDAS (digital patch panel). •Kept abreast of device both used in missions and under maintenance; monitored permanent links used. •Managed mission-related issues; handled changes, cancellations, and modifications by monitoring the SIPRnet for messages. •Guaranteed the quality of technical log entries and made certain that all troubleshooting steps were documented. •Assessed accuracy on all action reviews by ensuring proper documentation of log, fix actions and downtime before sending to the higher echelons.

title: Action Request Center (Helpdesk) Specialist
company: South Theater Network Operations and Security Center
description: •Facilitated activities in the BMC remedy service desk toolset as well as tracked and documented all remedy incident tickets. •Served as the terminal server access control system (TSACS) service manager responsible in rendering support to 741 service providers by coordinating with the technical support and providing troubleshooting assistance to users with communications problems. •Scrutinized diverse real-world circuits on the integrated network management system and SolarWinds along with the security on the intrusion detection system. •Created and compiled precise reports of different organizations through the Department of Defense on a daily, monthly and quarterly basis. •Managed the authorized service interruptions in the South Eastern United States, Central America, South America, and Caribbean Islands. •Assessed and attended to numerous requests for repairs from troubleshooting equipment to receiving and passing reports of critical outages. •Assumed lead role over the operational team in the absence of the supervisor by accomplishing assignments without direction, preparing facility for visitors, and monitoring facility work orders. •Took charge of presenting video teleconference briefings and tours to visitors such as VIPs, gaining favorable comments and accolades for superb performance.

title: T&E Program Support, Chief
description: Serves as the Chief of the T&E Program Support, to establish, review, enforce and supervise Test and Evaluation (T&E) policy and procedures and represent DISA to the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) oversight T&E community. Serves as T&E Liaison, in this capacity is responsible for the management of all programmatic activities and the adequacy, quality, and credibility of the program’s products for the entire T&E lifecycle as well as being responsible for continuous improvement of processes for the purpose of optimizing resources and technology and improving products. Serves as a test and evaluation expert providing advice, leadership and guidance to some of the DISA's programs regardless of the capability, size or scope, and consider the strategic goals of DISA's Test and Evaluation Executive, the Component Acquisition Executive as well as considerations that need to be made regarding the specific systems infrastructure, hardware, security framework, and software applications.

title: Program Analyst
description: Serves as a team lead for the Strategic Planning team on the Acquisition Services Branch (SS13) in providing direct support to the SATCOM PMO. Specific responsibilities include strategic planning and execution, managing program activities related to Acquisition Services, and overseeing analysis of interrelated department and agency strategic plans and policy initiatives that impact implementation of Department acquisition guidelines. Additionally, manages and provides acquisition oversight and direction to the Future Acquisition Services program activities within the PEO-STS portfolio. Serves as an Acquisition Advisor for the SATCOM PMO, in this capacity, serves as a leading expert and technical advisor in acquisition program management. Plans, designs and conducts studies and analyses of complex plans, programs and projects to identify and propose solutions to long standing management problems associated with complex, long-term scientific and technical missions in the PMO SATCOM Single Database (1DB) acquisitions and managements.

title: Cyber Security Program Manger and Cyber Operations Consultant
description: • Oversees Cyber Security and Operations Programs for the Army Directorate. • Responsible for directorate (at times company) level Business Development for Cyber Programs • Serves as the senior Cyber Security Architect and Operations Consultant in NES. • Responsible for providing comprehensive technical and operational expertise to all aspects of cyber security with a vast array of IT systems involving end user support to enterprise level networks for commercial and government agencies. • Ensures the architecture design for all customer projects maintain a strong focus on system reliability and security through the design, engineering, and implementation of complete end-to-end secure solutions across the targeted environment. • Supplies technical, policy and operational guidance to IA inspection programs to ensure compliance with NATO, US Government and commercial industry standards. • Provides direction on operations and infrastructure for offensive and defense cyber operations to include training, equipment procurement, planning and mission execution. • Delivers recognized expertise on threat mitigation and risk management across the entire spectrum of IT service delivery. • Leadership duties include but are not limited to directing programs for networking, service provision, and cyber security and information assurance covering all aspects of developmental planning, systems acquisition and operational employment of systems.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Cyber Security Architect / Cyber Operations Consultant (SME)
description: • Advises Executive Staff, Program Directors, Project Managers and the CIO on all aspects of Cyber Security Operations (offensive and defensive, IA Policy, Network Operations (NETOPS), and Tactical and Strategic Communications Systems •Technical consultant to the CIO for Joint Regional Security Stack (JRSS), Advance Data Analytics, Joint Information Environment (JIE), Enterprise Wireless, Network Management, Mission Command Systems, Joint Management System (JMS), Single Security Architecture (SSA), Cloud Based Architectures, Services and Security, Host Based Security and others programs/projects as needed •Advises on operational policies and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for all Army and Joint-level capabilities •Supports engineering, planning and implementation efforts for network and security modernization across the DoD (JRSS, MPLS, DISN-EN, JIE, JMS, etc.) •Manages operations for the CIO in support JRSS, MPLS and other projects as needed •Published various documents in support of JRSS, Enterprise Wireless, JIE, and JMS •Regularly briefs senior leaders at the Executive and General Officer level personnel

title: Division Chief Technical Officer/Senior Warrant
company: Army Cyber Command - Enterprise Management Division
description: • Served as the senior technical adviser to the director of the division, the Director Current Operations and the Deputy Commanding General – Operations for ARCYBER. • Conducted briefing and provided advice to General officers and Senior Executive Service (SES) on a regular basis. • Senior technical manager at the operations center (ACOIC) supporting over 1.2 million Army customers handling hundreds of cyber security and NETOPs related incidents daily. • Developed operational policies and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for all Army-level capabilities to ensure effective communications infrastructure management, readiness, security and oversight. • Supported ARCYBER Capabilities Gap Assessment for Cyber, IT and Operational disciplines. • Supported Cyber Protection Team (CPT) development, recruiting and operational planning. • Provided comprehensive technical and tactical expertise influencing two main lines of operations, directing Department of Defense Information Network (DoDIN) operations and Defensive Cyber Operations (DCO) on behalf of joint, intergovernmental, inter-agency, and multinational partner organizations pertaining to critical enterprise management efforts impacting the entire Army operational spectrum. • Action officer for Joint Regional Security Stack (JRSS), Joint Information Environment (JIE) and Host Based Security Systems (HBSS) projects. • ARCYBER lead on 12 projects valued in excess of $500 million dollars. • ARCYBER lead on funding re-appropriation actions with Congress for over $860M. • Managed ARCYBER HBSS analytic support team and the HBSS project management staff. • Served as Services and Networking Subject Matter Expert (SME) for high profile insider threat criminal case

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Plans and Operations Engineering Senior Technician
description: • Plans engineer and technical consultant for the III Corps G6 Staff. • Provided strategic and tactical network design, planning and operational management for all cyber, IA and communications activities in support of the III Corps Headquarters. • Lead the team integrating tactical and strategic C2 systems into seamless secure communications architecture to meet the headquarters information exchange requirements in support of Commander’s priorities and operational objectives • Acted as the Corps communications liaison to 2 divisions and 3 Brigade Combat Teams (BCTs) during Corp validation exercise for deployment supporting 5000+ personnel • Routinely supported planning and engineering for Corps separate Brigades and other units as directed. • Validated staff and subordinate unit communications requirements. • Coordinated with subordinate, assigned and superior units to provision validated communications requirements. • Represented the III Corps G6 staff on Army and Combatant Command (COCOM) technical and operational planning groups. • Corps Satellite Systems manager for over 100 SATCOM systems for all III Corps assigned FORSCOM units. • Action officer and communications engineer for III Corps Continuity of Operations Planning (COOP) operations

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Network Engineer / Network Operations+
description: • Duties included network design, network operations, and circuit request/management. • Focused on information security operations, strategic and tactical network design and theater level network management for the Corps network. • Served NETOPS and Engineering lead for the Corps’ first deployed Korea exercise in 25 years. • Lead engineering assessments of integration of tactical systems (WIN-T) equipment with Harris advance waveform radios. • Engineered and managed voice, video and data services for over 1200 personnel. • Lead communications planner for the Corps deployment to Iraq. • Conducted technical assessments on rapid deployment packages to support the Corps Commander. • Managed the 7 man network engineering team.

title: Senior Plans Engineer
description: • Plans engineer and technical consultant for the USF-I J6. • Strategic and tactical joint network design, planning and operations of all communications activities in Iraq support over 200,000 personnel. • Team lead responsible for planning network and services retrograde operations to ensure commander could control forces effectively while supporting the Presidential mandate to draw down. • Redesigned the network architecture to support next generation High Definition (HD) Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) platforms. • Lead planning officer for the USF-I black core Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) network supporting both DoD and Department of State operations. • Communications action officer reporting directly to the USF-I J6 for civil support projects for the cities of Basra, Irbil and Umm Qasr and the Al Basra Oil Terminal. • Action officer support for VIP visits for the Vice President of the United States and the Secretary of Defense. • Requested by name to support investigative operations into the use of commercial infrastructure to secure convoy operations. • Represented the USF-I J6 staff on technical and operational planning groups with the Joint Staff, USCENTCOM, State Department and other agencies. • Managed contracted engineering support staff.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Deputy Operations Officer
description: • Deputy Operations Officer and Current Operations Lead for NATO's only operational Cyber/Information Assurance organization. • Served as the Technical Adviser to the NATO IA policy board; this board serves as nation level representation to NATO policy • Lead over 100 Information Assurance (IA) and Communications Monitoring (COMSEC) inspections. • Provided team deployment planning and network design from a security operations perspective. • Responsible for the planning and execution of the Program of Work for 23 IA cells that conducted actions including IA Staff Assistance Visits (SAVs), network penetration evaluation and systems certification • Designed the technical interface of monitoring equipment to voice and data systems, and lead the maintenance program for all NATO communications security equipment. • Aided in the redesign of NATO’s gateway architecture; reduced the number of internet peering points from 22 to 3 to increase security and robustness. • Conducted IA inspections of all (80+) THALES contracted sites in Afghanistan; a $105 million project.

title: Manager, Camp Carroll Satellite Facility
description: • Officer In Charge (OIC) of the Camp Carroll Satellite Facility; a $18M heavy earth terminal. • Support of the DoD communications infrastructure for the Korean peninsula supporting over 50,000 personnel. • Facility provided secure and non-secure voice, data and video services through 250+ circuits using terrestrial and satellite transmission mediums. • Increased reliability rating from 76% to over 95% in 6 months. • Conducted a $750,000 powers systems upgrade on budget and ahead of schedule. • Saved the Army of $1.6 million through parts acquisition and maintenance adjustments over the course of 2 years. • Site was awarded the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA)-Korea facility of The Year in 2003 and 2004. • Responsible for the Global Broadcast System (GBS) Theater Injection Point (TIP) that provided real time intelligence products to DoD agencies in Korea and the Pacific Area of Operations (AOR). • Certified GBS TIP as operational and deployed for the first time in the DoD. • Managed 24 personnel in day-to-day operations, facility maintenance and technical upgrades.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Operations and Transmissions Planner
description: Transmissions Systems Engineer for a joint planning team as part of the Joint Communications Support Element (JCSE). I was responsible for physical and transmissions network engineering for missions/operations on a global scale. Systems includes multiplexers, satellite, line-of-site (LOS), switching and routing. Duties also included country frequency management, equipment movement, and on-site mission support. Customer base included US Agencies, Special Operations Forces, and US Combatant Commands.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

description: Design & project development of satellite V-Sat solutions, Sea Tel/Cobham certified Maritime systems, IMARSAT systems and satellite video conference system. Supervision and support of system implementation to systems integrators. Product training and presentations to new and existing clients. Technical sales support and proposal development, including VISIO network drawings. Managing vendors, sub-contractors and installations crews. Performing customer power point presentations, status reports and meetings.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

title: Member of Technical Staff
description: Design and implementation of satellite communication earth stations, networks & associated subsystems for domestic and international applications. Total turnkey satellite communications network solutions of voice, data, TV/Video broadcast systems integration, installation, test and training. Documentation/drawing development, and control. Support supply chain PO’s and clear concise equipment specifications and statement of work/deliverables. Sales support to include; Statements of Work, Requests for Proposal, and technical proposal evaluation. Milestone projects; 10 city network TOT Thailand, 44 City network EMETEL Ecuador, 5 city network Chile Sat, First AOR Intelsat earth station to replace Russian Inter-sputnik for BTC Bulgaria.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

summary: SME Telecommunications and Satellite communication professional skilled in areas of project engineering, site management, systems integration, and operations. Extensive experience in facilities construction, Telecom, Satcom, Mobile, OSP/ISP fiber optics systems. Document development and configuration management to comply with ISO and MIL standards. Dynamic leader and dedicated team player with ability to learn quickly, problem solve, and drive initiatives in a fast paced Corporate environment. Acquired significant DoD experience, possess Active DoD Secret Security Clearance. Milestone accomplishments: Modernization and upgrade programs at; Fort Bliss, Fort Benning, Fort Sam Houston, Fort AP Hill, West Point, Raven Rock Mountain. Development of complex telecom networks; Global Star Gateway Toulouse France, TOT 10 city Thailand network, ENTEL Bolivia, 44 City EMETEL Ecuador, EMBRATEL Brazil and Portugal Telecom Cape Verde Africa. Technologies and systems; Telecom, Satcom, Wireless, Mobile, Fiber Optics, Systems Integration, Voice/VoIP systems Foxcomm, Comtech/EF Data, iDirect, SeaTel/Cobham, Radyne, Cisco DWDM ONS, Nortel, AVAYA, ERP/MRP manufacturing system.

title: Senior Information Systems Security Engineer
description: Manages and supports the DIACAP process for all Information Systems, enclaves, and applications under the DoD Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) Stakeholders. Reviews, coordinates, and recommends IA standards and protocols for cost effective application in accordance with the Department of Defense’s (DOD) Defense in Depth (DID) strategies and supporting documentation. Initiates and plans for project and systems descriptions to ensure design and implementation comply with DIACAP requirements. Ensures compliance with Federal, DOD and DLA information technology and security requirements, policies, procedures and standards as applicable.

title: Network Enterprise Support Team Operations Manager
description: Directed integrated team of military and civilian personnel tasked with command and control of the Network Enterprise Centers (NEC) at 11 Army installations to include budgeting, acquisition procurement, contracting, personnel and system optimization, network design and implementation, incorporation of new technologies, as well as enterprising and automating the global network . Responsible for team goal setting and training, team evaluations, obtaining equipment, personnel safety, scheduling, approval and oversight of all team travel. Led nearly every major team mission, including security inspection preparation and major Army initiatives such as Enterprise Email and Vista migrations at several major Army installations. Assisted installations in meeting Department of Defense (DOD) accreditation standards needed to operate on the LandWarNet (LWN) through DIACAP, CCRI, DAIG and COMSEC inspections, patching, compliance scanning, STIG and IAVA compliance direct and indirect technical assistance (tier 1 and 2 support), CND, C&A, incident handling and coordination of assets. Managed the execution and enforcement of Command, Control, Communications, Computers and Information Management (C4IM) activities.

title: Systems Integration and Intelligence Warfare Officer
description: Directed 10 member team of electronic warfare, intelligence, and communications specialists. Implemented and maintained networks, information insurance and security posture, accountability, and accreditation to include incident response and handling, intrusion detection, and threat identification for the Division’s Secure Compartmentalized Information Facilities (SCIF); both at Fort Hood and while deployed through two deployments to Iraq. Rewrote and implemented Division’s DOD Intelligence and Information Systems (DODIIS) SOP; passed Forces Command DODIIS inspection. Configured, troubleshot, maintained, and secured all computing and networking assets for Division’s Intelligence section; operating over Top Secret (TS), secret, and non-secure networks. Researched new and expanding technologies and equipment that would better optimize the network while staying compliant with DOD and Army directives and standards. Coordinated fielding and implementation of all new intelligence equipment and contractor support for MND-B

summary: Active U.S. Government TS /SCI/SSBI Experienced InfoSec and Cyber Security leader with CISSP Microsoft Certified Information Technology Professional – Enterprise Administrator Over 17 years of experience operating, maintaining and managing networks and supervising IT professionals DoDD 8570 Certified IAT II that has led teams and assisted teams with many DIACAP, CCRI and DAIG validations Managed major initiatives to enterprise and standardize the Army network infrastructure IAT II that has led and assisted with many DIACAP and DIACAP preparation validations 7 years of Incident Handling, Risk Management, and Certification and Accreditation (C&A) experience Risk Management / C&A experience for the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) and Defense Security Service (DSS) Expert with Information Technology implementation and testing Possess unique combination of technical and interpersonal skills and knowledge with many Army/DOD Enterprise technologies to seamlessly work with military and civilian leadership and technicians at all levels Certified COMSEC (Communications Security) Inspector Trained on all aspects of Strategic and Tactical SATCOM terminals and associated equipment
