title: PD Defense Wide Transmission Systems, Modem Integration Technician
description: Serve as a Modem Integration Technician (MIT) for US Army Program Executive Office - Enterprise Information Systems (PEO EIS) Product Director, Defense Wide Transmission Systems (PD DWTS). Responsible for technical oversight on the removal and replacement of Combat Service Support, Very Small Aperture Terminal (CSS VSAT) satellite modems for the U.S. Army’s CSS Satellite Communications (SATCOM) program. Modem retrofits were completed in order to migrate VSAT remote terminals from “Legacy” network to DCATS Commercial Satellite Communications Network (DCN). Responsibilities include the removal of iConnex 700 modem from terminal modem tray, installation of iConnex e800, upgrading firmware and configuration of Garmin GPS for remote terminal to modem positioning communication, coordination with RIA Network Operations Security Center (NOSC) to transition existing “Legacy” systems to DCN as well as conduct compression testing of terminal transmit power output, captured MAC addresses and configured Cisco 7911/7912 VOIP telephone’s TFTP server settings for network compatibility. Lead for essential strategic planning and coordinating of project events including asset procurement/acquisition as well as hardware/software analysis. Provide logistical analysis for CSS SATCOM Program Support Office including planning, materials handling, scheduling, and budget requirements.

title: PD Defense Wide Transmission Systems, Senior Fielding Team Lead
description: Supervised a team of 20 instructors in the operation and management of the Combat Service Support Automated Information Systems Interface (CSS CAISI) and VSAT Training Team. Responsible for and overseer of all aspects of coordination, scheduling, and providing requirements for fielding of CAISI 2.0 and CSS VSAT instruction and support. Conducted one-on-one and platform trainings for Army and Department of Defense (DoD) organizations. Conducted over 30 successful fielding assignments and equipment issues. Trained operator and maintainer's courses to over 200 U.S. Army soldiers. Directly responsible for issuing of equipment valued at over $11,000,000 USD. Responsible for system updates and firmware upgrades to wireless bridges, encryptors (Juniper), and operating systems on laptop computers (Windows XP to WIN7). Operated as POC for Tier 2 and Tier 3 escalation for the CAISI help desk involving both telephone and field troubleshooting. Routinely prepare and present fielding After-Action Reports (AARs) for DoD customer's requirements and in support of government contractor reporting. Performed data interpretation, cost/budget analysis, and compiled detailed financial reports for conducting fielding assignments and allocation of equipment. Working knowledge of Information Assurance and system security requirements. Applications include: HBSS, McAfee Solidcore, BitLocker, Encryption Wizard, and antivirus programs such as Symantec Endpoint Protection. Perform employee evaluations. Excel at meeting/exceeding customer needs and cultivating productive working relationships.

title: PM AKO/DKO, Field Service Technician
description: Coordination of infrastructure and software migration from Microsoft Exchange Servers to the AKO enterprise email system. Provided desktop troubleshooting support to users during server migration process. Managed and serviced accounts for DoD organizations stationed at multiple PEO EIS locations including Fort Belvoir, VA; Fort Eustis, VA; FT. Monmouth, NJ; Fort Shafter, HI; and New Orleans, LA. Installation of the “Go Mobile” app for government handheld peripherals (i.e. cell phones & tablets), adhering to DoD Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG). Installed software on local user’s computers, built user .pst files; lead and repaired the provisioning of mobile devices (Blackberry OS, Android OS, & Apple iOS). Lent administrative support and expertise while gaining extensive technical knowledge of Microsoft Office Outlook. Acted as the liaison for PM AKO/DKO and interacted with various organization’s POCs, local server teams/NEC and high ranking officials. Drafted AARs, monthly action progress reports and weekly status reports in support of PM AKO/DKO.

title: PM Defense Wide Transmission Systems, Senior Technical Trainer
description: Conducted one-on-one and platform training for Army and DofD organizations. Conducted over 37 successful fielding assignments and equipment issues. Served as a primary instructor for operator and network administrator courses to over 300 U.S. Army soldiers worldwide. Configuration, validation, and testing of components such as encryption devices (Juniper & Cisco), routers, wired bridges (DSL), wireless bridges (Air Fortress ES-520), VOIP phones, and radios. Responsible for coordinating, scheduling and providing requirements for fielding and CAISI and CSS VSAT instruction. Inspection, testing and servicing of components of satellite ground stations. Validated, wrote and reviewed training documents, curriculums and materials; conducted research on CAISI module components and VSAT satellite system units. Working knowledge of IEEE standards for networking, Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 140-2, the U.S. Army's regulation regarding Information Assurance (AR 25-2), as well as the Information Assurance Vulnerability Management (IAVM) Program.

title: Joint Staff, J-8 ADD Comms/Networks, Acting Sr EA and Deputy Chief, Information Transport Div
description: Assistant Deputy Directorate for Communications and Networks, Force Structure, Resources, and Assessment Directorate (J-8), Joint Staff, Pentagon, 2007-Present (previously J-6) - Provides oversight and strategic guidance on space, aerial, and terrestrial C4 systems to the Director and Vice Director, J-8. Reviews and defines current and future information transport capabilities and evaluates C4 programs to ensure they meet joint warfighter requirements. Coordinates and provides oversight of 28 joint military action officer, civilians, and contractors in providing best military advice to the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Oversaw development and acquisition of C4 SATCOM; Position, Navigation, and Timing; and terminal programs (JTRS, WIN-T, WGS, MUOS, AEHF, GPS), all providing critical capabilities to the warfighter. Effectively led effort to develop options for down scoping C4 requirements to potentially reduce cost and schedule overruns for a major Nuclear C2 ground and airborne terminal program; briefed findings to Net-Centric Functional Control Board and gained board's unanimous endorsement. Directed interservice teams in development and approval of Joint Space Communications Layer and Joint Aerial Layer Networking Initial Capability Documents describing C4 capability gaps within Combatant Commands, Services, and Agencies; these efforts will help shape the development of space and aerial materiel solutions in the long-term future. Selected to serve as acting Chief of Staff during last two months of assignment.

title: Operations Officer
description: Planned and executed U.S. Army-Pacific's (USARPAC) participation in several major theater-level exercises within the Pacific Theater of Operations. Lead for relocating and transforming previous signal command structure into an OPLAN-focused strategic and tactical C4 enabler for USARPAC; efforts ensured command achieved initial and final operating conditions (IOC/FOC) on time. Supervised the planning, installation, operation, and maintenance of C4 transport and data systems supporting a forward C2 headquarters and dispersed humanitarian relief sites in the Philippines during Exercise Balikatan; communications reliability exceeded 0.99. Twice directed the Joint C4 Control Center (JCCC) that planned and monitored all SATCOM, voice, data, Integrated Work Station, and VTC systems/circuits supporting Exercise Terminal Fury; commended by 4-star JTF Commander for outstanding support.

title: Senior Communications Engineer
description: Designed/engineered major and minor modifications to the communications segment of the existing Air Force Satellite Control Network (AFSCN). Successfully installed and tested a 44.736 Mbps (DS3) circuit from the AFSCN Terminal at Ka'ena Point, HI to the Wahiawa Naval Communications Terminal, replacing a failing microwave circuit between both locations; project was completed on time and within budget. Familiar with DS1 and DS3 signal analyzers, oscilloscopes, spectral analyzers, and other test equipment. Promoted to Senior Engineer in nine months after employment.

title: Cyber Security Program Manger and Cyber Operations Consultant
description: • Oversees Cyber Security and Operations Programs for the Army Directorate. • Responsible for directorate (at times company) level Business Development for Cyber Programs • Serves as the senior Cyber Security Architect and Operations Consultant in NES. • Responsible for providing comprehensive technical and operational expertise to all aspects of cyber security with a vast array of IT systems involving end user support to enterprise level networks for commercial and government agencies. • Ensures the architecture design for all customer projects maintain a strong focus on system reliability and security through the design, engineering, and implementation of complete end-to-end secure solutions across the targeted environment. • Supplies technical, policy and operational guidance to IA inspection programs to ensure compliance with NATO, US Government and commercial industry standards. • Provides direction on operations and infrastructure for offensive and defense cyber operations to include training, equipment procurement, planning and mission execution. • Delivers recognized expertise on threat mitigation and risk management across the entire spectrum of IT service delivery. • Leadership duties include but are not limited to directing programs for networking, service provision, and cyber security and information assurance covering all aspects of developmental planning, systems acquisition and operational employment of systems.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Cyber Security Architect / Cyber Operations Consultant (SME)
description: • Advises Executive Staff, Program Directors, Project Managers and the CIO on all aspects of Cyber Security Operations (offensive and defensive, IA Policy, Network Operations (NETOPS), and Tactical and Strategic Communications Systems •Technical consultant to the CIO for Joint Regional Security Stack (JRSS), Advance Data Analytics, Joint Information Environment (JIE), Enterprise Wireless, Network Management, Mission Command Systems, Joint Management System (JMS), Single Security Architecture (SSA), Cloud Based Architectures, Services and Security, Host Based Security and others programs/projects as needed •Advises on operational policies and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for all Army and Joint-level capabilities •Supports engineering, planning and implementation efforts for network and security modernization across the DoD (JRSS, MPLS, DISN-EN, JIE, JMS, etc.) •Manages operations for the CIO in support JRSS, MPLS and other projects as needed •Published various documents in support of JRSS, Enterprise Wireless, JIE, and JMS •Regularly briefs senior leaders at the Executive and General Officer level personnel

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Division Chief Technical Officer/Senior Warrant
company: Army Cyber Command - Enterprise Management Division
description: • Served as the senior technical adviser to the director of the division, the Director Current Operations and the Deputy Commanding General – Operations for ARCYBER. • Conducted briefing and provided advice to General officers and Senior Executive Service (SES) on a regular basis. • Senior technical manager at the operations center (ACOIC) supporting over 1.2 million Army customers handling hundreds of cyber security and NETOPs related incidents daily. • Developed operational policies and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for all Army-level capabilities to ensure effective communications infrastructure management, readiness, security and oversight. • Supported ARCYBER Capabilities Gap Assessment for Cyber, IT and Operational disciplines. • Supported Cyber Protection Team (CPT) development, recruiting and operational planning. • Provided comprehensive technical and tactical expertise influencing two main lines of operations, directing Department of Defense Information Network (DoDIN) operations and Defensive Cyber Operations (DCO) on behalf of joint, intergovernmental, inter-agency, and multinational partner organizations pertaining to critical enterprise management efforts impacting the entire Army operational spectrum. • Action officer for Joint Regional Security Stack (JRSS), Joint Information Environment (JIE) and Host Based Security Systems (HBSS) projects. • ARCYBER lead on 12 projects valued in excess of $500 million dollars. • ARCYBER lead on funding re-appropriation actions with Congress for over $860M. • Managed ARCYBER HBSS analytic support team and the HBSS project management staff. • Served as Services and Networking Subject Matter Expert (SME) for high profile insider threat criminal case

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Plans and Operations Engineering Senior Technician
description: • Plans engineer and technical consultant for the III Corps G6 Staff. • Provided strategic and tactical network design, planning and operational management for all cyber, IA and communications activities in support of the III Corps Headquarters. • Lead the team integrating tactical and strategic C2 systems into seamless secure communications architecture to meet the headquarters information exchange requirements in support of Commander’s priorities and operational objectives • Acted as the Corps communications liaison to 2 divisions and 3 Brigade Combat Teams (BCTs) during Corp validation exercise for deployment supporting 5000+ personnel • Routinely supported planning and engineering for Corps separate Brigades and other units as directed. • Validated staff and subordinate unit communications requirements. • Coordinated with subordinate, assigned and superior units to provision validated communications requirements. • Represented the III Corps G6 staff on Army and Combatant Command (COCOM) technical and operational planning groups. • Corps Satellite Systems manager for over 100 SATCOM systems for all III Corps assigned FORSCOM units. • Action officer and communications engineer for III Corps Continuity of Operations Planning (COOP) operations

title: Network Engineer / Network Operations+
description: • Duties included network design, network operations, and circuit request/management. • Focused on information security operations, strategic and tactical network design and theater level network management for the Corps network. • Served NETOPS and Engineering lead for the Corps’ first deployed Korea exercise in 25 years. • Lead engineering assessments of integration of tactical systems (WIN-T) equipment with Harris advance waveform radios. • Engineered and managed voice, video and data services for over 1200 personnel. • Lead communications planner for the Corps deployment to Iraq. • Conducted technical assessments on rapid deployment packages to support the Corps Commander. • Managed the 7 man network engineering team.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Senior Plans Engineer
description: • Plans engineer and technical consultant for the USF-I J6. • Strategic and tactical joint network design, planning and operations of all communications activities in Iraq support over 200,000 personnel. • Team lead responsible for planning network and services retrograde operations to ensure commander could control forces effectively while supporting the Presidential mandate to draw down. • Redesigned the network architecture to support next generation High Definition (HD) Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) platforms. • Lead planning officer for the USF-I black core Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) network supporting both DoD and Department of State operations. • Communications action officer reporting directly to the USF-I J6 for civil support projects for the cities of Basra, Irbil and Umm Qasr and the Al Basra Oil Terminal. • Action officer support for VIP visits for the Vice President of the United States and the Secretary of Defense. • Requested by name to support investigative operations into the use of commercial infrastructure to secure convoy operations. • Represented the USF-I J6 staff on technical and operational planning groups with the Joint Staff, USCENTCOM, State Department and other agencies. • Managed contracted engineering support staff.

title: Deputy Operations Officer
description: • Deputy Operations Officer and Current Operations Lead for NATO's only operational Cyber/Information Assurance organization. • Served as the Technical Adviser to the NATO IA policy board; this board serves as nation level representation to NATO policy • Lead over 100 Information Assurance (IA) and Communications Monitoring (COMSEC) inspections. • Provided team deployment planning and network design from a security operations perspective. • Responsible for the planning and execution of the Program of Work for 23 IA cells that conducted actions including IA Staff Assistance Visits (SAVs), network penetration evaluation and systems certification • Designed the technical interface of monitoring equipment to voice and data systems, and lead the maintenance program for all NATO communications security equipment. • Aided in the redesign of NATO’s gateway architecture; reduced the number of internet peering points from 22 to 3 to increase security and robustness. • Conducted IA inspections of all (80+) THALES contracted sites in Afghanistan; a $105 million project.

education: [{"name"=>"University of Hartford", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1996 – 2003"}, {"name"=>"NCI, Kentucky 2001", "description"=>"Electrical, Electronics and Communications Engineering", "period"=>"2000 – 2000"}, {"name"=>"Martins Ferry High School", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1988 – 1992"}]
summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Manager, Camp Carroll Satellite Facility
description: • Officer In Charge (OIC) of the Camp Carroll Satellite Facility; a $18M heavy earth terminal. • Support of the DoD communications infrastructure for the Korean peninsula supporting over 50,000 personnel. • Facility provided secure and non-secure voice, data and video services through 250+ circuits using terrestrial and satellite transmission mediums. • Increased reliability rating from 76% to over 95% in 6 months. • Conducted a $750,000 powers systems upgrade on budget and ahead of schedule. • Saved the Army of $1.6 million through parts acquisition and maintenance adjustments over the course of 2 years. • Site was awarded the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA)-Korea facility of The Year in 2003 and 2004. • Responsible for the Global Broadcast System (GBS) Theater Injection Point (TIP) that provided real time intelligence products to DoD agencies in Korea and the Pacific Area of Operations (AOR). • Certified GBS TIP as operational and deployed for the first time in the DoD. • Managed 24 personnel in day-to-day operations, facility maintenance and technical upgrades.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Operations and Transmissions Planner
description: Transmissions Systems Engineer for a joint planning team as part of the Joint Communications Support Element (JCSE). I was responsible for physical and transmissions network engineering for missions/operations on a global scale. Systems includes multiplexers, satellite, line-of-site (LOS), switching and routing. Duties also included country frequency management, equipment movement, and on-site mission support. Customer base included US Agencies, Special Operations Forces, and US Combatant Commands.

title: Program Manager / Business Development Manager
description: I was the Program Manager for the WWSS and GTACS contract vehicles and all associated Delivery Orders under those contracts. The Delivery Orders provided equipment and support for various customers such as the Marine Corps, PM WIN-T, PM IEW&S, and Northcom Commands. I managed my company BD interface with various CECOM Program Managers, including Project Managers for Army Communication Programs. I provided analysis for teaming agreements and data on competition. I provided technology and market research.

title: Owner
description: I started this consulting business after Fort Monmouth closed. I worked with companies that needed a presence within the Aberdeen Proving Grounds, Fort Dix and Fort Belvoir communities. I provided information on upcoming programs and who key decision makes were. I made introductions and arranged meeting with Program Managers, Program Leads and System Engineers which included PM WIN-T, PM –DWTS, PM, DCATS, PM- Command Post, PM-C3T, and the CSTP office. I provided data on competition. Some of the companies that I worked with were Aspen Systems, Acumentrics, Wavestream, RaySat, and Hughes Networks

title: Business Development Manager
description: I managed my company BD interface with various CECOM Program Managers, including Project Managers for Army Communication Programs. These PM include PM WIN-T, PM –DWTS, PM, DCATS, PM- Command Post, PM-C3T, PM TRCS, and the CSTP office at Fort Monmouth, Fort Belvoir, Fort Dix and Aberdeen Proving Grounds. I work directly with the PM’s to understand and document requirements and discuss design issues on programs like WIN-T Inc 1 and SWAN. I translated customer requirements and system design into strategy recommendations for GD senior management and won RHN and DKET programs. I assist in new product development. I provided market and technology research. I pursue and qualify new opportunities for GD.

title: Sales Engineer

title: Chief Member Technical Staff
description: I was assigned to the iDirect Installation Team and am a certified iDirect Technician. I have installed iDirect Hubs in Poland, Croatia for the Ministry of Defense, SPAWAR in Tampa Fl, Aberdeen Scotland, Gilford England, and Pan Am Sat in Ga. I was assigned to Iraq and installed 7 separate iDirect TDMA remote sites in support of the Army Corps of Engineers. I traveled to the US Embassy in Karachi, Pakistan to provide assistance during an installation of a 3.8 meter satellite dish and communication equipment. I was the Project Leader on the Parsons BEH (Buildings for Education and Healthcare), Parsons S&J (Security and Justice), and Parsons RIO (Replace Iraqi Oil) projects in Iraq where I installed an iDirect remote TDMA communications system located at Camp Victory, the Green Zone in Baghdad, and Kirkuk Iraq. These TDMA systems provided internet and VOIP connectivity. I filled the role of network engineer for the iDirect Hub at Fort Monmouth, NJ. This hub is responsible for supporting CENTCOM and AMC TDMA sites in Iraq. I was deployed to Afghanistan as an operator of a Multi-Media Communications System (MMCS). This system provide NIPR, SIPR, secure voice, VOIP, and secure VTC capabilities for AMC, CENTCOM and DIA I have configured Cisco switches and routers to support VOIP and multiple VLAN’s. I have experience with Cisco Call Manager, Active Directory, and Microsoft Exchange servers. I have installed network accelerators on SIPR networks in Afghanistan. I am certified in fiber optic splicing and terminations.

title: Lead Technician
description: I was a field technician to the Space and Terrestrial Communication Directorate, Communications Electronics Command, Research Development and Engineering Center at Ft Monmouth, NJ. I planned the implementation and testing of the AN/USC-28 Spread Spectrum Multiple Access (SSMA) modem with the Advance Channel Simulator for DTRA, the installation of Un-interruptible Power Supply (UPS) for entire control systems lab; and the testing of RF absorbent foam for implementation in RFIS units worldwide. I conducted the planning, implementation, and testing of new TCCC architecture for replacement of old systems worldwide. I conducted a study and presented findings to DISA on re-evaluation of cesium clock standards for the AN/GSC52 HT/MT modifications. I managed the operations and maintenance of the hardware and software of various DSCS control subsystems to include DFCS, RFIS, and FCS.

title: Satllite Controller
description: Responsibilities included command and control of systems aboard DSCS Spacecraft and associated tactical strategic communications networks to embody Frequency Division Multiple Access (FDMA), and SSMA networks. I managed the implementation of DSCS operational database and network planning software, and the operation and maintenance of control systems and test equipment. I was certified as a SCCE (Satellite Communication and Control Element) operator for which made me accountable for the health and welfare of the spacecraft.

title: Senior Watch Officer - Senior Network Analyst – Network Operation Center
description: Senior Watch Officer-Senior Network Analyst – Network Operation Center – ARMA Global,LLC – U.S Army - Fort Belvoir, VA. April 2012 – Present - Monitors networks to ensure uninterrupted availability of network resources. - Proactively monitors network platforms and applicable systems in order to identify potential problems, and performs appropriate corrective measures, via demand or scheduled maintenance actions. - Fix Tier 1 and 2 Altiris Trouble Tickets within 72 hours for Microsoft Windows XP/7.0 environment. - Create and manage accounts on Active Directory. - Troubleshoot Windows XP/7 outages. - Perform administration, maintenance, troubleshooting and support of Microsoft Office, Exchange, and Active Directory. - Experience in management of all desktop/laptop workstations from initial installation to repairs and replacement. - Experience in configuration, assembly and installation of workstation and associated peripherals. - Experience in adding and removing software applications that are required by the customers. - Provides Tier 2 IT support for the Customer, providing the technical guidance as well as troubleshooting, installation, removal, and replacement of defective hardware components, drivers and equipment, the installation and configuration of Microsoft server operating systems and applications. - Perform system administration, troubleshooting, and support of Microsoft Server 2003/2008 systems, servers, storage and various applications - Identifies and clears port security trips on CISCO routers and switches. - COMSEC manager experience. - Investigates system alarms, assesses conditions and determines correct response or course of action necessary to protect the assigned network. - Coordinates and/or implements emergency restoration activities in outage situations; advises appropriate personnel of network failures or degradation and assists in arranging for corrective action plans. - Maintains documentation of daily operations.

title: Senior Lead Engineeer
description: Senior Lead Engineer and Training Manager for Global Broadcast Service and Various Other Satellite Systems. General Dynamics – Advanced Information Systems - Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance Systems – Chantilly, VA - Lead Global Broadcast Service trainer that develops, manages and trains all SATCOM technicians prior to deployment to world-wide locations. - Provides senior engineering and technical leadership in satellite and terrestrial communication systems and networks. - Responsible for developing, managing and conducting all training for various government agencies to include Department Homeland Security and The National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency. - Have personally trained over 1200 government and civilian personnel in the setup, operation, deployment and maintenance of SATCOM and communications systems in world-wide locations for over 20 years. - Supports deployed communications systems and networks with extensive knowledge of UNIX, TCP/IP, Cisco routers, switches and hubs. - Performs systems updates to include security patches, firmware updates, configuration changes, installing and maintaining operating systems, user account maintenance, etc. - Alternate COMSEC Manager for General Dynamics Deployed Services. Contract employs 49 members of GD-AIS in support of NGA programs. Responsible for the COMSEC training of assigned personnel on the contract and the inventory and issuance of all COMSEC equipment. Extensive experience with cryptographic equipment such as ViaSat KG-250. Considered Subject Matter Expert. - Provides Help Desk technical support to worldwide deployed technicians on hardware and software issues that may arise.

title: Associate
description: Training and Fielding Support for the Global Broadcast Service (GBS). - Specific duties include coordinating fielding and training requirements with C4I Centers and worldwide deployed clients to prepare training sites for upcoming NET instruction. - Prepared cost estimates for training, travel and other direct costs related to the project within budget restrictions to include classroom requirements, properly identified students and equipment availability. - Traveled to client sites and performs fielding of equipment and conducts NET training on the GBS system. Training includes the setup, operation and maintenance of the GBS receive suites. - Coordinated with property book officers the issuance and turn in of all equipment to the gaining unit. - Prepared instructions and trains the integration of the GBS system with the Local Area Network (LAN). - Provided worldwide helpdesk support for technical issues related to the GBS program. Manager of C4I Laboratory/Trainer of the Global Broadcast Service (GBS) for PM WIN-T MILSATCOM at Fort Monmouth, NJ. Booz Allen Hamilton, Inc. - Specific duties included on call 24 hour Help Desk support for world-wide deployed Army units on the GBS Receive Suite equipment. Technical expertise included performing laboratory experimentation (e.g., integration, data distribution, sourcing of broadcast products, etc.), traveling to user sites to assist with integration of GBS into their architecture, assisted with fielding and user training, performed web publishing to assist in the dissemination of GBS Program information to Army and other users/interested parties. - Training lead for the only Army team that provided Operator, System Administrator, Security Administrator and Maintenance courses to Army personnel at world-wide locations for the GBS Receive Suite.

summary: I am a Technician experienced at providing the highest standard of quality in the areas of installation, service, and maintenance, working with various media. My unprecedented customer service is documented through calls and e-mails from satisfied customers, leading to recognition, service awards and exceptional evaluations. My professionalism is shown through my attendance record, positive attitude and outstanding scores for quality and on-time service with negligible errors. I am interested in associating myself with a company whose focus is customer-driven, expecting from it's employees integrity, loyalty and dedication which is rewarded with an opportunity to grow in knowledge and responsibility in a career, and not just a job. Skills/Knowledge: * Demonstrated ability to assemble, test and troubleshoot analog and digital electronic devices, wiring harnesses, cables, switch panels, and other electrical equipment according to diagrams, schematics, board layouts, dimensioned drawings, blueprints, engineering data and knowledge of electrical principles * Communications knowledge/experience in RF, Satellite, Broadband, Fiber Optics, Data Networks and Telephony * Proficient use of test equipment such as Network Analyzers, Spectrum Analyzers, Multi-meters, Oscilloscopes, Signal Generators, RF Power meters (Trilithic 860 & JDSU), Cable Leakage Meter (Trilithic Seeker),and CLI

title: Cyber Security Program Manger and Cyber Operations Consultant
description: • Oversees Cyber Security and Operations Programs for the Army Directorate. • Responsible for directorate (at times company) level Business Development for Cyber Programs • Serves as the senior Cyber Security Architect and Operations Consultant in NES. • Responsible for providing comprehensive technical and operational expertise to all aspects of cyber security with a vast array of IT systems involving end user support to enterprise level networks for commercial and government agencies. • Ensures the architecture design for all customer projects maintain a strong focus on system reliability and security through the design, engineering, and implementation of complete end-to-end secure solutions across the targeted environment. • Supplies technical, policy and operational guidance to IA inspection programs to ensure compliance with NATO, US Government and commercial industry standards. • Provides direction on operations and infrastructure for offensive and defense cyber operations to include training, equipment procurement, planning and mission execution. • Delivers recognized expertise on threat mitigation and risk management across the entire spectrum of IT service delivery. • Leadership duties include but are not limited to directing programs for networking, service provision, and cyber security and information assurance covering all aspects of developmental planning, systems acquisition and operational employment of systems.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Division Chief Technical Officer/Senior Warrant
company: Army Cyber Command - Enterprise Management Division
description: • Served as the senior technical adviser to the director of the division, the Director Current Operations and the Deputy Commanding General – Operations for ARCYBER. • Conducted briefing and provided advice to General officers and Senior Executive Service (SES) on a regular basis. • Senior technical manager at the operations center (ACOIC) supporting over 1.2 million Army customers handling hundreds of cyber security and NETOPs related incidents daily. • Developed operational policies and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for all Army-level capabilities to ensure effective communications infrastructure management, readiness, security and oversight. • Supported ARCYBER Capabilities Gap Assessment for Cyber, IT and Operational disciplines. • Supported Cyber Protection Team (CPT) development, recruiting and operational planning. • Provided comprehensive technical and tactical expertise influencing two main lines of operations, directing Department of Defense Information Network (DoDIN) operations and Defensive Cyber Operations (DCO) on behalf of joint, intergovernmental, inter-agency, and multinational partner organizations pertaining to critical enterprise management efforts impacting the entire Army operational spectrum. • Action officer for Joint Regional Security Stack (JRSS), Joint Information Environment (JIE) and Host Based Security Systems (HBSS) projects. • ARCYBER lead on 12 projects valued in excess of $500 million dollars. • ARCYBER lead on funding re-appropriation actions with Congress for over $860M. • Managed ARCYBER HBSS analytic support team and the HBSS project management staff. • Served as Services and Networking Subject Matter Expert (SME) for high profile insider threat criminal case

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Plans and Operations Engineering Senior Technician
description: • Plans engineer and technical consultant for the III Corps G6 Staff. • Provided strategic and tactical network design, planning and operational management for all cyber, IA and communications activities in support of the III Corps Headquarters. • Lead the team integrating tactical and strategic C2 systems into seamless secure communications architecture to meet the headquarters information exchange requirements in support of Commander’s priorities and operational objectives • Acted as the Corps communications liaison to 2 divisions and 3 Brigade Combat Teams (BCTs) during Corp validation exercise for deployment supporting 5000+ personnel • Routinely supported planning and engineering for Corps separate Brigades and other units as directed. • Validated staff and subordinate unit communications requirements. • Coordinated with subordinate, assigned and superior units to provision validated communications requirements. • Represented the III Corps G6 staff on Army and Combatant Command (COCOM) technical and operational planning groups. • Corps Satellite Systems manager for over 100 SATCOM systems for all III Corps assigned FORSCOM units. • Action officer and communications engineer for III Corps Continuity of Operations Planning (COOP) operations

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Network Engineer / Network Operations+
description: • Duties included network design, network operations, and circuit request/management. • Focused on information security operations, strategic and tactical network design and theater level network management for the Corps network. • Served NETOPS and Engineering lead for the Corps’ first deployed Korea exercise in 25 years. • Lead engineering assessments of integration of tactical systems (WIN-T) equipment with Harris advance waveform radios. • Engineered and managed voice, video and data services for over 1200 personnel. • Lead communications planner for the Corps deployment to Iraq. • Conducted technical assessments on rapid deployment packages to support the Corps Commander. • Managed the 7 man network engineering team.

title: Senior Plans Engineer
description: • Plans engineer and technical consultant for the USF-I J6. • Strategic and tactical joint network design, planning and operations of all communications activities in Iraq support over 200,000 personnel. • Team lead responsible for planning network and services retrograde operations to ensure commander could control forces effectively while supporting the Presidential mandate to draw down. • Redesigned the network architecture to support next generation High Definition (HD) Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) platforms. • Lead planning officer for the USF-I black core Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) network supporting both DoD and Department of State operations. • Communications action officer reporting directly to the USF-I J6 for civil support projects for the cities of Basra, Irbil and Umm Qasr and the Al Basra Oil Terminal. • Action officer support for VIP visits for the Vice President of the United States and the Secretary of Defense. • Requested by name to support investigative operations into the use of commercial infrastructure to secure convoy operations. • Represented the USF-I J6 staff on technical and operational planning groups with the Joint Staff, USCENTCOM, State Department and other agencies. • Managed contracted engineering support staff.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Deputy Operations Officer
description: • Deputy Operations Officer and Current Operations Lead for NATO's only operational Cyber/Information Assurance organization. • Served as the Technical Adviser to the NATO IA policy board; this board serves as nation level representation to NATO policy • Lead over 100 Information Assurance (IA) and Communications Monitoring (COMSEC) inspections. • Provided team deployment planning and network design from a security operations perspective. • Responsible for the planning and execution of the Program of Work for 23 IA cells that conducted actions including IA Staff Assistance Visits (SAVs), network penetration evaluation and systems certification • Designed the technical interface of monitoring equipment to voice and data systems, and lead the maintenance program for all NATO communications security equipment. • Aided in the redesign of NATO’s gateway architecture; reduced the number of internet peering points from 22 to 3 to increase security and robustness. • Conducted IA inspections of all (80+) THALES contracted sites in Afghanistan; a $105 million project.

title: Manager, Camp Carroll Satellite Facility
description: • Officer In Charge (OIC) of the Camp Carroll Satellite Facility; a $18M heavy earth terminal. • Support of the DoD communications infrastructure for the Korean peninsula supporting over 50,000 personnel. • Facility provided secure and non-secure voice, data and video services through 250+ circuits using terrestrial and satellite transmission mediums. • Increased reliability rating from 76% to over 95% in 6 months. • Conducted a $750,000 powers systems upgrade on budget and ahead of schedule. • Saved the Army of $1.6 million through parts acquisition and maintenance adjustments over the course of 2 years. • Site was awarded the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA)-Korea facility of The Year in 2003 and 2004. • Responsible for the Global Broadcast System (GBS) Theater Injection Point (TIP) that provided real time intelligence products to DoD agencies in Korea and the Pacific Area of Operations (AOR). • Certified GBS TIP as operational and deployed for the first time in the DoD. • Managed 24 personnel in day-to-day operations, facility maintenance and technical upgrades.

summary: • Over 22 years of operationally focused Information Technology (IT) and Cyber Security leadership, design and management experience. • Skills cover a wide array of operations, communications and security disciplines required to support organizations ranging from large 100,000+ customer environments to small tactical teams working in austere remote locations. • Extensive experience interfacing with multiple government agencies and industry leaders to help improve infrastructure, security and services to better support organizational missions and goals. • Over 8 years of project management experience. • Serves as a senior technical adviser to the most senior officers and executives in Cyber and Communications for Army and other DoD Agencies. • Active TS/SCI Security Clearance (June 2013) Functional Specialties: Cyber security and network operations and planning; Army, Agency and Department level Cyber Security and Information Assurance (IA) policy and guidance; Special Operations support and Joint Communications planning; Network and application security technology implementation to include firewalls, IPS/IDS, Host Based Security Systems (HBSS), Web Content Filtering (WCF), Security Information and Event Mangers (SIEM), sensor grid design, passive data collection and active data/transmissions interception; Advanced analytic implementation; Cloud based storage and security; Network engineering, implementation and management to include IP networks, voice, encryption and transmissions systems; Long haul communication mediums to include: satellite, fiber optic, Line-of-Site (LOS) and Beyond-LOS.

title: Operations and Transmissions Planner
description: Transmissions Systems Engineer for a joint planning team as part of the Joint Communications Support Element (JCSE). I was responsible for physical and transmissions network engineering for missions/operations on a global scale. Systems includes multiplexers, satellite, line-of-site (LOS), switching and routing. Duties also included country frequency management, equipment movement, and on-site mission support. Customer base included US Agencies, Special Operations Forces, and US Combatant Commands.

title: Sr. Manager, NRCC Operations
description: Conceptualize, design and render solutions to emerging business requirements such as governmental compliance mandates, Sirius XM merger activities and repeater network scope changes. Analyze existing processes and give direction and guidance to improve these monitor and control systems. Give operations and engineering direction to the NRCC field engineering contractors and their managers across the US and Canada. Manage the operations of the NRCC to include: staff resource balancing, demands for resources from outside customers, coordination with internal corporate customers and systems uptime. Manage operations of 1000 L and S Band repeaters in US, Canada, and Puerto Rico. Manage special projects such as assessing the affect of uplink or modulation changes to the repeater network. Analyze repeater network performance data and produce reports that illustrate performance trends that are used to predict failure rates of devices. Create, maintain and de-conflict the NRCC Ops Staff schedule, the NRCC Tier 3 engineering schedule and the Repeater Operations staff contact list. Make decisions within engineering guidelines that affect tower worker safety and conduct planned power reductions to mitigate risk.

title: Network Operations Manager
description: Conceptualize, design and render solutions to emerging business requirements such as governmental compliance mandates, Sirius XM merger activities and repeater network scope changes. Analyze existing processes and give direction and guidance to improve these monitor and control systems. Give operations and engineering direction to the NRCC field engineering contractors and their managers across the US and Canada. Manage the operations of the NRCC to include: staff resource balancing, demands for resources from outside customers, coordination with internal corporate customers and systems uptime. Manage operations of 1000 L and S Band repeaters in US, Canada, and Puerto Rico. Manage special projects such as assessing the affect of uplink or modulation changes to the repeater network. Analyze repeater network performance data and produce reports that illustrate performance trends that are used to predict failure rates of devices. Create, maintain and de-conflict the NRCC Ops Staff schedule, the NRCC Tier 3 engineering schedule and the Repeater Operations staff contact list. Make decisions within engineering guidelines that affect tower worker safety and conduct planned power reductions to mitigate risk.

title: Network Controller
description: Operate National Repeater Control Center and interface with repeater maintenance contractors on operational issues on 1000 L and S Band systems in the US, Canada, and Puerto Rico. Use XM’s Remedy Trouble Management System to dispatch, document and track repairs and work-in-progress. Operate National Repeater Control Center and interface with repeater maintenance contractors on operational issues. Understand and execute standard operating procedures to control ground network computer equipment, ground-based communications link equipment, transmitter equipment and RF test equipment. This includes transmit power adjustments, anomaly identification, system troubleshooting, restoration procedures and documentation. Ensure that corrective actions and technical solutions are implemented in a timely fashion to restore network performance. This includes reacting to emergencies and making decisions within approved guidelines.

title: SATCOM Shift Supervisor / SYSCON OIC
description: Performed duties as the E-Company SYSCON OIC and SATCOM Shift Supervisor, representing and responsible to the Commander, E-Company 302nd US Army Signal Battalion, for the total continuity of communications services and operational communications capabilities, facilities and personnel supporting the E-Company mission. Supervised, directed, and counseled 7 soldiers, ensuring welfare and career progression.

title: Maintenance NCOIC / Asst. OIC for 229th Sig. Co.
description: Performed duties as Maintenance NCOIC for 229th Signal Company, responsible for the overall maintenance and functionality of all satellite communications equipment for the only Army tactical satellite company in the Republic of Korea in support of United States Forces Korea, Central Forces Command, and United Nation Command. • Established maintenance schedules, directed and supervised troubleshooting on 8 AN/TSC- 85C’s, 8 AN/TSC-93C’s, 3 AN/TSC-156’s, 25 rapid deployment tactical satellite antennas, and all associated satellite and test equipment, valued in excess of $20 million. • Developed, directed, coordinated, supervised, led, and assisted troubleshooting 3 communications maintenance support teams, specializing in all areas of Army tactical communications equipment, for troubleshooting and maintenance throughout the entire Korean peninsula. • Developed and instructed satellite communications maintenance school for the 307th Signal Battalion, taught to units’ tactical satellite personnel throughout the Korean peninsula. Completed approximately 500 priority 1 work orders in 27 months. • Developed new, pocket sized loopback tester for use with Tactical Satellite Terminals, Troposcatter Terminals, and associated cabling. • Routinely coordinated and troubleshot with equipment manufacturers, such as L-3 and Harris, to expedite repair and saved the company funds by not having to ship items away for repair.

title: ROK/US JC4I Co-Chair, Negotiator & Sr. US C4I Engineer/Architect
description: Chief of Plans responsible for Joint Transformation, Yongsan Relocation Plan & Land Partnership Program (YRP/LPP) and Joint Information Environment (JIE) initiatives for a forward deployed theater signal brigade. Serves as the US Vice-Chairman to the C4I Joint Working Group (C4IJWG); responsible for the master planning, execution, coordination and status reporting for all C4I activities throughout the entire Korean Theater of Operations (KTO) supporting the UNC, CFC, USFK, and Eighth United States Army and its major subordinate commands. Executes international negotiations and implementation of mutual agreements between the ROK and U.S. government for the planning, and programming, prioritizing, and validating requirements for over $1 billion worth of C4I assets. Provides staff updates to General Officers regarding status all C4I activities; and a SATCOM facility valued over $60 million.

title: Chief of Staff, Joint Staff Support Center (JSSC)
description: Chief of Staff for the Joint Staff Support Center (JSSC), a nominatively manned, Joint organization providing the President, Secretary of Defense, CJCS, warfighting combatant commanders, the Services and agencies with around-the-clock C4 Systems support. Responsible for daily operations of the command to include personnel, budget planning and execution, contract oversight and execution, the Global Command and Control (C2) System operations (global and local), National Military Command Center, C2 System operations, and oversight of facilities and property management valued at over $42M. Oversees development and implementation of the unit strategic operations plan, positioning the command for future missions and customers. Directs special projects, defines tolerances and trusts, evaluates project manager estimates, guides implementation, and provides executive program guidance.

title: Commander
description: Deployed in a combat zone, serves as the Director, Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Support Element, Afghanistan (DSE-A), United States Forces-Afghanistan. Provides leadership and supervision for the administrative, logistical, technical, and operational planning and execution functions in support of Defense Information Systems Network and C5ISR solutions. Develops and maintains coordination and planning relationships with multiple levels of Joint, U.S. Army and Coalition Commands, the Afghanistan Ministry of Communication and Information Technology, Afghanistan Telecom (AFTEL), and commercial wireless providers. Ensures the DISA mission is represented in current and future operations throughout the CJOA-A. Represents the Commander, DISA Central Field Command on all matters and provides DISA Program Support.

title: Command Duty Officer (CDO)--Global Operations (GO)
description: Serve as the Defense Information Systems Agency Command Center (DCC) Senior Watch Officer. Directs and provide command and control capabilities for the design, engineer, procurement, provisioning and operations and network defense of the Department of Defense (DoD) Global Information Grid GIG) continuously operating and assuring global net-centric enterprise operation in direct support to Combatant Commands, Sub-Unified Commands, Federal Agencies and the Executive Office of the President. Leads 215 Joint personnel in DISA’s Command Center; executes C2 of 16K personnel/DISA’s $8.1B global mission. Governs DISA’s 29 Field Offices, cords with 64 CC/S/A, advises senior DISA leadership on issues affecting GIG operations. Prioritizes NetOps msns impacting 15K nets/3.5K world-wide sites, directs 7K (1.5B) global telecom circuits’ ops. Provides 74 Tier 2 CND services to 34 DoD-wide agencies, coords with USCYBERCOM to protect & defend the GIG.

title: Chief / Senior Systems Engineer
description: Serves as the Senior Information Systems Officer in the Directorate of Network and Information Services, Information Technology Agency (ITA) in the Pentagon. Responsible for the technical and functional integration of IT programs and services across the DoD network infrastructure in support of the Joint Staff, National Military Command Center, Defense Intelligence Agency, National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency, and the DISA Joint Staff Support Center. Coordinates all communications requirements to ensure essential National Military Command Systems connectivity for worldwide C2, situation monitoring, and crisis management. Manages the daily operations of the Executive Communications Team consisting of 1 officer and 9 senior NCO's supporting the senior DoD leadership communications inside and outside of the National Capital Region. Responsible for Planning, Programming, Budgeting and Execution (PPBE) process for Network and Information Services in the Pentagon.

title: Director of Communications, Army Intelligence CIO
description: Responsible for Army Staff plans and policy coordination. Serves as the Army DCS, G-2 staff element responsible for Army Intelligence Information Management (IM) and Information Technology (IT) issues. Supports IM/IT policy, strategic planning, Year 2000, and the Army Enterprise Architecture. Supports Intelligence communications issues to include Integrated Broadcast Service (IBS) plans, Defense Message System (DMS), and communications development efforts like the JWICS Mobile Integrated Communications System (JMICS). Performs an Army Executive Agent role for JMICS and the Joint Collection Management Tool. Serves as the Army General Defense Intelligence Program Functional Manager for Intelligence Information Systems. Provides DCS, G-2 Information Systems Security support. title: QA/QC Chief, Shop Foreman, and Tech Controller
description: Worked within a electronic maintenance shop performing initial inprocessing of electronic equipment and final QA/QC inspections on all AN/TSC-86 tactical satellite and multiplexer components, computers, printers, and monitors that had been repaired. Performed Shop Foreman duties in charge of 25 repairmen. Also worked within the Fort Buckner Tech Control as a Shift Supervisor performing troubleshooting and fault isolation of various strategic microwave (LOS), matrix switch, multiplexers (SONET, Prominas, FCC-100s, FCC-98s and DPAS). Utilized the Fireberd, T-Berd, and Oscilloscope to troubleshoot data circuits and voice trunks.

title: Tech Controller, Facility Control Office, Electronics Repair Supervisor
description: Work at Corozal Tech Control and Facility Control Office performing troubleshooting and fault isolation on various systems to include IDNX,-20,70,90 (Promina), FCC-100s, Timeplex Satellite Multiplexer and D4 channel banks. Installation of tactical circuits and rewiring strategic circuits on the IDF and MDF. Utilized the FireBerd, Oscilloscope, and Buttset to troubleshoot data and voice circuits. Loading and performing HJs on Crypto. Performing Loop-backs and Alt routes on the K-patch and patch panels. Also assigned to the 154th Signal Battalion as a Satellite, Switch and LOS repair supervisor. Supervised five soldiers on the repair of AN/TSC-85s and 93s shelters and antennas, Mobile Subscriber Equipment (MSE) LOS radios, Node Centers, LENs and SENs and RAUs.

title: Information Operations Virtual Team Lead
description: ♦ Mr. Morrissey executed cyberspace operations and SIGINT tasks in support of naval and joint forces and national tasking authorities. ♦ He organized numerous Navy cryptologic operations and supported the security and defense of the Navy's portion of the Global Information Grid ♦ He coordinated with other naval, coalition and Joint Task Forces to execute the full spectrum of cyber, electronic warfare, information operations and signal intelligence capabilities and missions across the cyber domains.

name: Joseph Morrissey
groups: [{"name"=>"Cryptologic Technician (CT) Alumni", "link"=>"http://www.linkedin.comhttp://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=66926&goback=%2Enpp_joseph*5morrissey%2F14%2F76%2F649&trk=fulpro_grplogo"}, {"name"=>"SATCOM", "link"=>"http://www.linkedin.comhttp://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=155836&goback=%2Enpp_joseph*5morrissey%2F14%2F76%2F649&trk=fulpro_grplogo"}]
education: [{"name"=>"National Cryptologic School", "description"=>"RPTG3225 Reporting Bootcamp", "period"=>"2014 – 2014"}, {"name"=>"National Cryptologic School", "description"=>"NETA3006 Certification, Digital Network Intelligence", "period"=>"2011 – 2011"}, {"name"=>"National Cryptologic School", "description"=>"NETA2020GR DNI Analyst Certification, Digital Network Intelligence, Pass", "period"=>"2009 – 2009"}, {"name"=>"N-MARC Goodfellow AFB", "description"=>"Journeyman 9138 NEC Certificate, Analysis and Reporting", "period"=>"2007 – 2008"}, {"name"=>"Corry Station, CTR 'A' School", "description"=>"450 Certificate, Communication Signals Collection and Processing SIGINT", "period"=>"2006 – 2006"}]
summary: Mr. Joseph Morrissey's Intelligence Community background includes over eight years of combined joint military and civilian experience spanning the sphere of the intelligence collection, analysis and production cycle as a multi-disciplined Intelligence Analyst. Recently, he conducted SIGINT analysis, attribution, mitigation, counter-operations, and tool development in support of foreign computer network operations (FCNO) intelligence requirements at Fort Belvoir, VA. His previous experience includes digital network intelligence (DNI) analysis, SIGINT development (SIGDEV), computer networking analysis, and digital network recognition (DNR) link analysis. He possesses a solid understanding of Service, DoD, and IC intelligence and security policy, authorities, guidelines and regulations. Mr. Morrissey has performed over 14 years of military service to include one deployment to the U.S. Central Command area of responsibility and four years of sea-deployments with the U.S. Navy.

title: SIGINT Cyber Discovery Analyst
description: ♦ Mr. Morrissey analyzed exploitation opportunities for cryptologic systems and networks, including vulnerabilities, algorithms, and new methods of attack. ♦ He characterized cyber intrusion events, categorized hacker tactics and methods, performed dynamic analysis of malware, and provided real-time network analysis for national-level computer network operations (CNO). ♦ Mr. Morrissey assisted the Target Knowledge Officer (TKO) with capturing and extracting target knowledge, which enabled data-sharing, evaluation, and leveraging target knowledge via an Intelligence Community’s Cloud database. ♦ He maintained liaison with multiple intelligence agencies, and provided tip-offs and reports to various intelligence agencies.

summary: Mr. Joseph Morrissey's Intelligence Community background includes over eight years of combined joint military and civilian experience spanning the sphere of the intelligence collection, analysis and production cycle as a multi-disciplined Intelligence Analyst. Recently, he conducted SIGINT analysis, attribution, mitigation, counter-operations, and tool development in support of foreign computer network operations (FCNO) intelligence requirements at Fort Belvoir, VA. His previous experience includes digital network intelligence (DNI) analysis, SIGINT development (SIGDEV), computer networking analysis, and digital network recognition (DNR) link analysis. He possesses a solid understanding of Service, DoD, and IC intelligence and security policy, authorities, guidelines and regulations. Mr. Morrissey has performed over 14 years of military service to include one deployment to the U.S. Central Command area of responsibility and four years of sea-deployments with the U.S. Navy.
