title: Senior Integrated Product Support Manager
description: Senior Integrated Product Support Manager As the Integrated Product Support (IPS) Manager is to ensure the 12 IPS elements are properly planned, resourced, and implemented for the following assigned systems; Common Network Planning Software (CNPS), Replacement Satellite Configuration Control Element (RSCCE), Global Satellite Configuration Control Element (GSCCE), Frequency Control Subsystem (FCS), Satellite Communications Set (AN/USC-28), Replacement Patch and Test Facility (RPTF), Replacement Radio Frequency Interconnecting Subsystem (RRFIS), Replacement Frequency Modulated Order-Wire (RFMOW), Wideband Global Spectrum Monitoring System (WGSMS) and Joint Management Operations System (JMOS).These actions will enable the system to achieve the operational readiness levels required by the soldier at the time of fielding and throughout the life cycle. As the IPS logistics lead I am responsible for the following Acquisition actions: Coordinate with the System and Developmental Engineer to obtain a list of system and spare requirements for system development and fielding for 5 WSOCS and 6 remote sites. Identify and coordinate with the contracting agency to place the equipment on contract, ensure funding is available and provided and track progress to contract award. Upon contract award, track deliveries and ensure proper equipment is delivered and accounted for at Aberdeen Proving Grounds, Joint SATCOM Engineering Center, Software Engineering Center and DRS Depot. Conduct inventories all sites. Maintain Wideband Area Work Flow account and update account as deliveries are received. As the Integrated Product Lead for Wideband Satellite Operation Center the following tasks are conducted: .

description: Responsibilities included recruiting, training and supervising customer service specialists, also responsible for fostering an environment in which customers enjoyed high levels of service and employees were motivated to deliver top performance. • Oversaw cash flow requirements, including safe transactions, approving checks and refunds, and monitoring cash handling procedures. • Reconciled ledgers for the store through correspondence with banks and customers • Supervised all phases of the reconciliation process including balancing the safe, tills, and entering and balancing all sales and cash transactions. • Managed in-store accounts receivable, mailing statements to customers, as well as, preparing and proofing daily deposit slips. • Controller of quarterly labor, inventory expenses, cash shortages, and also verifying checking expense through store sales, store labor, and store expense reports. • Oversaw the coordination of training in conjunction with Personnel Coordinator • Created quarterly budget expense plans. • Provided guidance and assistance to Personnel Coordinator and Efficiency Scan Coordinator. • Managed and scheduled duties for store associates. • Directed and controlled all store operations in the absence of Store Director • Conducted performance appraisals as outlined by company guidelines.

title: Information Security Specialist, LEAD
description: -Assessments and Authorizations subject matter expert supporting Government client's program management. -Provide recommendations concerning safeguarding of information systems with a focus on risk analysis, mitigation, and compliance with Federal policies for Information Assurance (IA) using the ICD 503 Risk Management Framework. -Support risk assessments for information systems and provide authorization recommendations including but not limited to: Operational Approval To Test (OATT), Approval To Proceed (ATP), and Approval To Operate (ATO). -Led FISMA Security Inspections, and provided security posture evaluations on networks assessed -Ensure security control assessment is scheduled and completed on an annual basis and any findings are addressed in the system POA&M -Ensure the System Security Authorization Agreement (SSAA) documents for each system are properly prepared, maintained, and accurately reflect the definition, development, security testing

summary: U.S. Army Veteran in the field of Information Systems Management (FA53) in Northern Virginia; As an Officer and Manager in the field of Cyber Security, I’ve been successful at and received acclamation for leading projects and teams of geographically dispersed CERT’s (Computer Emergency Response Teams) to solutions that prevented the spread of malicious software across Army networks as well as the conduct of vulnerability assessments; I’ve successfully supervised teams of up to 60 members with budgetary and property responsibility valued up to $71 million in high stress environments with zero losses; Provided recommendations concerning safeguarding Information Systems with a focus on FISMA compliance for Information Assurance (IA). Currently serve as a Principal Risk Advisor to the NGA (National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency) DAO (Delegated Authorizing Official) on all technical and non-technical information security issues.

title: FA53 Information Systems Management Officer, U.S. Army
description: -As MST Lead, worked with the NSA Red Team to provide support to Computer Network Operations (CNO) mission planning, technical analysis, and Concept of Operations (CONOP) development to Cyber OPFOR (Opposing Force) missions for Terminal Fury exercise 2010; as Certified Army Penetration tester, participated as Army Red Team member in the first U.S. Cyber Command cyber attack exercise, Cyber Flag 2012-1. -As Battalion Logistics Officer, procured and maintained accountability of the Battalions geographically dispersed property located in AZ, GA, Europe, Korea, Kuwait and Southwest Asia resulting in zero losses, including all hardware and software valued at over $71,000,000; I recovered the accountability of the Battalion’s Property Management from a dismal state of neglect earning the highest achievable rating in the area of Supply Management Discipline during the Inspector General’s Command Inspection Program.

summary: U.S. Army Veteran in the field of Information Systems Management (FA53) in Northern Virginia; As an Officer and Manager in the field of Cyber Security, I’ve been successful at and received acclamation for leading projects and teams of geographically dispersed CERT’s (Computer Emergency Response Teams) to solutions that prevented the spread of malicious software across Army networks as well as the conduct of vulnerability assessments; I’ve successfully supervised teams of up to 60 members with budgetary and property responsibility valued up to $71 million in high stress environments with zero losses; Provided recommendations concerning safeguarding Information Systems with a focus on FISMA compliance for Information Assurance (IA). Currently serve as a Principal Risk Advisor to the NGA (National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency) DAO (Delegated Authorizing Official) on all technical and non-technical information security issues.

title: Network Defense Watch Officer (NDWO), U.S. Army
description: -Managed 35 technical Security Professionals in the execution of a global CND (Computer Network Defense) Operation to include real-time incident handling and reporting of cyber threats. -I led and directed the research and technical analysis for all events that prevented the widespread of malicious software on Army networks by ensuring compliance with the DISA (Defense Information Systems Agency) IAVM (Information Assurance Vulnerability Management) and DIACAP (DoD Information Assurance Certification and Accreditation Process) process. -Coordinated the global response efforts for six RCERTs (Regional Computer Emergency Response Teams) located in Arizona, Georgia, Europe, Korea, Kuwait and Southwest Asia that resulted in hundreds of foiled potential network compromises in real-world crisis situations. -Briefed senior leadership daily on recent cyber threats and events; recommended preventive, mitigating, and compensating controls to ensure the appropriate level of protection of the Army network to adhere to the goals of security of the Army’s IA (information assurance) and security strategy.
skills: ["Information Assurance", "Computer Security", "Network Security", "Military", "Security", "Command", "Army", "Emergency Management", "COMSEC", "DoD", "CISSP", "DIACAP", "Military Operations", "Networking", "Information Security"]

title: FA53 (Information Systems Manager) & Signal Captain's Career Course, Student
company: Fort Gordon School of Information Technology
description: -One year of technical training and instruction in common core information technology subjects including radio and data communications, and network planning. -Cisco Academy IT Essentials of Networking (attaining the Cisco Certified Network Associate certification), Cisco Security Professional, Microsoft Technologies, Solaris 10 System Administration, Windows Security, and System Security Certified Practitioner; routing and switching, Cisco Security Professional, and Microsoft Technologies were also provided. -Leadership/Management training included Commanding and controlling small to mid-sized Army organizations of 200-300 Soldiers.

summary: U.S. Army Veteran in the field of Information Systems Management (FA53) in Northern Virginia; As an Officer and Manager in the field of Cyber Security, I’ve been successful at and received acclamation for leading projects and teams of geographically dispersed CERT’s (Computer Emergency Response Teams) to solutions that prevented the spread of malicious software across Army networks as well as the conduct of vulnerability assessments; I’ve successfully supervised teams of up to 60 members with budgetary and property responsibility valued up to $71 million in high stress environments with zero losses; Provided recommendations concerning safeguarding Information Systems with a focus on FISMA compliance for Information Assurance (IA). Currently serve as a Principal Risk Advisor to the NGA (National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency) DAO (Delegated Authorizing Official) on all technical and non-technical information security issues.

title: Communication Support Office Liaison Officer/ Help Desk Manager
description: -As Action Officer, ensured the SOC’s (Strategic Operations Center) Chief of Operations and all staff elements could monitor, report, and integrate on-going operations across the country of Iraq to the Commanding General. -Identified and resolved a critical intelligence gap in the SOC that led to my planning and fielding of a critical $250,000 Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) feed installation ensuring the solution of continued receipt of real-time intelligence supporting the operation. -Responsible for accountability, administration, and management of all Multinational Force- Iraq (MNF-I) Strategic Operations Center’s (SOC) automated information systems valued at over $1,000,000. -Managed 8 highly skilled Network and Security Professionals for helpdesk support in the high-stress, fast-paced Global War on Terrorism; Experience with identifying and resolving network and Level-One user problems; Established and maintained Microsoft exchange accounts, and associated computer hardware and software; communicated solutions and administered training to each of the SOC’s end-users.
skills: ["Information Assurance", "Computer Security", "Network Security", "Military", "Security", "Command", "Army", "Emergency Management", "COMSEC", "DoD", "CISSP", "DIACAP", "Military Operations", "Networking", "Information Security"]

title: Platoon Leader/ Company Executive Officer (XO)/ Signal Officer (25A)
company: Delta Company, 122d Signal Battalion, Eighth U.S. Army (EUSA)
description: -As Platoon Leader, planned, and directed the movement of communication packages for tactical/field operations, and maintenance of Mobile Subscriber Equipment (MSE) valued at over $53,000,000. -Responsible for the health, training, welfare, morale, and especially combat readiness of 53 U.S. Army Soldiers, and 5 Korean Army Soldiers over the course of the tour. -As Executive Officer, filled a role typically reserved for more senior Lieutenants, selected to be Company Information Management Officer (IMO) to plan network configurations. -Responsible for the management and proper use of secure communications equipment requiring classified cryptographic material; Information security, operations security, physical security, and planning for disaster recovery were all integral elements of the mission planning process.

summary: U.S. Army Veteran in the field of Information Systems Management (FA53) in Northern Virginia; As an Officer and Manager in the field of Cyber Security, I’ve been successful at and received acclamation for leading projects and teams of geographically dispersed CERT’s (Computer Emergency Response Teams) to solutions that prevented the spread of malicious software across Army networks as well as the conduct of vulnerability assessments; I’ve successfully supervised teams of up to 60 members with budgetary and property responsibility valued up to $71 million in high stress environments with zero losses; Provided recommendations concerning safeguarding Information Systems with a focus on FISMA compliance for Information Assurance (IA). Currently serve as a Principal Risk Advisor to the NGA (National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency) DAO (Delegated Authorizing Official) on all technical and non-technical information security issues.

summary: U.S. Army Veteran in the field of Information Systems Management (FA53) in Northern Virginia; As an Officer and Manager in the field of Cyber Security, I’ve been successful at and received acclamation for leading projects and teams of geographically dispersed CERT’s (Computer Emergency Response Teams) to solutions that prevented the spread of malicious software across Army networks as well as the conduct of vulnerability assessments; I’ve successfully supervised teams of up to 60 members with budgetary and property responsibility valued up to $71 million in high stress environments with zero losses; Provided recommendations concerning safeguarding Information Systems with a focus on FISMA compliance for Information Assurance (IA). Currently serve as a Principal Risk Advisor to the NGA (National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency) DAO (Delegated Authorizing Official) on all technical and non-technical information security issues.

title: Network Analyst II
description: Member of Windstream's Data Network Operations Center – IP Division (DNOC IP) where we manage and troubleshoot the IP network for data, enterprise, and cloud/hosted business customers: •Respond to trouble tickets (involving layer 3 connectivity and reachability) for devices on Windstream’s data network, addressing hardware and configuration issues. •Dispatch and work with technicians to troubleshoot faulty network equipment such as supervisor engines, SFPs, XFPs, power supplies, line cards, chassis. •React to network outages, taking ownership of the issue from start to finish, communicating issues quickly to upper management, coordinating with field operations, and conducting management and troubleshooting bridges. •Work closely with vendors to troubleshoot/replace equipment. •Notify carriers and peering companies of issues such as downed NNI/circuits, peering issues, APS failovers, and other IP related issues. •Work closely with market engineers to address scalability issues, hardware/software upgrades, and maintenances •Catch and mitigate DOS attacks on Windstream’s data network. •Write, script, and work Network Maintenances. •Work with and troubleshoot protocols: BGP, EIGRP, ISIS, STP, MPLS •Equipment: Redback SE-400/800; Cisco 2500,3400, 3750, 5300, 7200, 7600, 10k, 12410; Alcatel 7750; Juniper M, Mi, MX-Series •Troubleshoot network connection deficiencies, including Aggregation Routers, Edge Routers, Distrobution routers, Route Reflectors, T3 lines, fiber optics, and GigEthernet circuits •Train/Mentor new network analysts on network infrastructure and troubleshooting. •Train new and experienced network analysts on specific areas (Routing, Switching, circuits, etc) •Assist other network analysts with troubleshooting/programming network connections and devices. •Assist with other groups (Transport, VoIP, Network Security, Data Translations, Customer Service)
skills: ["Security Clearance", "Network Administration", "Information Assurance", "Cisco Technologies", "VPN", "Active Directory", "VMware", "Satellite Communications", "CCNA", "Security+", "Network + Certified", "System Administration", "Cisco Routing &...", "Cisco Firewall Security", "VoIP", "SNMPc", "Remote Administration", "TACLANE", "Routers", "Hardware", "Cisco Routers"]
name: Matthew McGowan

title: SATCOM Operations NCO and Rear Detachment Brigade S6 NCOIC
description: I currently work as one of 3 network administrators that work in the Brigade Network Operations Center and support 3500 users throughout the Brigade. During this time I maintain equipment ranging from VoIP phones, routers, switches, firewalls, line of sight communications, and anything other equipment that is associated to the network at the time. I also do the planning for all of the Satellite communications equipment throughout the Brigade. When the systems are up and running I help the operators install, operate, and maintain the equipment at their designated locations. I also serve as a Brigade system administrator. I work on everything from creating accounts in active directory, helping with enterprise email migrations, phones, printers, software, hardware, and if needed elevating issues to Tier I support. I also serve as the Information Assurance officer for a select network that only certain individuals are allowed access too.

Responsible for providing 24 hour voice communications directly for the President of the United States, Vice President, Senior Government Staff and Officials, the USSS, and other governmental agencies. Coordinates and communicates routinely with the US State Department, White House Situation Room, National Military Command Center, and other government agencies, organizations, and officials in order to provide personalized service to the White House, Cabinet members, and their staff.

title: Instructor
description: Instructed and supervised all initial entry, Army CMF 25, Soldiers during a six day combined exercise. The weekly exercise is designed to show the CMF 25 Soldiers how their respective fields work with the other 25 series MOS's to provide a wide spectrum of communications capabilities on the battle field and around the world. Communications platforms used each week consisted of all primary and secondary communications equipment utilized by each MOS.

title: SATCOM Terminal Chief
description: • Led and trained five Senior Noncommissioned Officers and 72 Soldiers • Managed routine equipment maintenance, preventive maintenance, and logistical programs for a large communications facility valued at over $540 M in direct support of the President of the United States, National Airborne Operations Center, Combatant Commanders, and numerous other government agencies • As Facility Safety Officer supervised safety programs and risk analysis for all employees, •Spearheaded the turn-in of $1.6 M worth of excess communications equipment eliminating more obsolete equipment than any other unit in the Brigade • Ensured that proper maintenance was conducted on company equipment and the successful closure of 872 work orders • Supervised the accountability of inventory for over 440 spare communication parts and supplies valued at over $3M • Prepared work schedules for over 72 Soldiers and ensured a close working environment between military, civilian employees, and contractors while providing 24/7 operational capability • Analyzed available equipment, materials, and personnel while establishing a priority of work and sequence of operations for complex projects and provided recommendations to superiors • Supervised, planed, and coordinated the installation and turn-in of equipment for multiple complex projects on-site and at remote locations involving numerous agencies while maintaining a high level of customer service • Provided leadership for annual operating and maintenance programs which gathered available manpower and equipment along with the special skills and capabilities of the soldiers, civilians, and contractors. • Responsible for the development, management, and implementation of training and testing programs

title: Plans & Operations Division Supervisor (Sr NCO)
description: Monitored & maintained joint satellite & telecommunications circuit networks for US Combined Forces Command. Coordinated all single channel tactical satellite communications in support of VIP travel for Commander-in-Chief U. S. Forces Korea. Coordinated multi-channel Ground Mobile Forces (GMF) satellite communications for Joint Contingency missions & Joint Exercises. Prepared/conducted weekly/monthly briefings for Commander-in-Chief on status of all Peninsula based communications circuits. Processed, maintained, & validated requests for strategic/tactical satellite & telephone communication. Updated circuit diagrams for Global Command and Control System Korea (GCCS-K). Provided mentoring and guidance to 15 military personnel.

summary: Certified Knowledge Management professional with over 20 years of IT and Project Management experience in the government and private sector. Customer-oriented leader with proven management, interpersonal, and communication skills, able to manage diverse work groups drawn from multiple disciplines and with varying skill levels. Successful record of planning and executing projects, translating business requirements and processes into creative solutions, reducing costly inefficiencies, with an ability to excel in high-pressure environments, bringing in projects on time and on budget. White House Communications Agency Executive Officer of the Network Systems Division. Retired Chief Warrant Officer 250NE3 Network Management and Satellite Communications Technician for the US Army, experience analyzing, designing, consulting, deploying and managing multi-million dollar IT projects and facilities. Specialties: Knowledge Management, Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft CRM, Defense Ready, ITIL, MBA, Information Systems, IT Management.

summary: Certified Knowledge Management professional with over 20 years of IT and Project Management experience in the government and private sector. Customer-oriented leader with proven management, interpersonal, and communication skills, able to manage diverse work groups drawn from multiple disciplines and with varying skill levels. Successful record of planning and executing projects, translating business requirements and processes into creative solutions, reducing costly inefficiencies, with an ability to excel in high-pressure environments, bringing in projects on time and on budget. White House Communications Agency Executive Officer of the Network Systems Division. Retired Chief Warrant Officer 250NE3 Network Management and Satellite Communications Technician for the US Army, experience analyzing, designing, consulting, deploying and managing multi-million dollar IT projects and facilities. Specialties: Knowledge Management, Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft CRM, Defense Ready, ITIL, MBA, Information Systems, IT Management.

title: Verizon FNS; Chief Knowledge Officer; Knowledge Management, SharePoint and Web Team Lead
description: Provide Knowledge Management based on industry standards and best business practices, creating efficiencies through ITIL methodologies and business process analysis. Deliver agile SharePoint, InfoPath, Web development projects, Executive dashboards, web sites, and custom applications. Developed courses and instruct as part of the on-boarding program, deliver customer immersion training on new and existing IT systems. Knowledge Management team consistently recognized for delivering solutions, informative training, and their ability to collaborate. Project lead on Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system that supports Human Resources, Security, Electronic Medical Records, Logistics, Finance and Training, replacing several legacy systems, increasing efficiencies and cutting cost from maintaining separate systems. Automated the document staffing process and project lead on fielding and training electronic signature system, reducing travel costs, delays, and creating an auditable system for paperless initiative. Project lead for the implementation, customization, and change management of Microsoft CRM, SharePoint, and their associated SQL databases. Increased SharePoint utilization improving collaboration, situational awareness, team work, and reducing duplication of efforts. Established taxonomy, naming convention and versioning, enabling ease of storage, reuse, and recall of data. Lead Knowledge Management Working Group (KMWG) allows the KM team to deliver consistent products and service throughout the customer’s diverse client base. IT Service Management (ITSM) board member, documenting processes and services to meet ITIL standards. Interface with other contracts, Permuta (DefenseReady), AFRL (ISSE Guard), and CACI (RM-Online) to ensure customer’s processes and current and future requirements are thoroughly documented, cutting down on errors and delivery time. Conduct research on new products and procedures; develop input for policy and planning.

title: Executive Officer Network DIV; Presidential Communications Officer; Network Architecture Branch OIC
description: Executive Officer responsible for budget, plans, and scheduling for the Divisions projects and personnel. Drafting and staffing Statements of Work, Statements of Requirements, and recommendations on strategic projects design, implementation, staffing, and operations and maintenance of all associated WAN circuits and equipment that directly supported the President’s communications. Presidential Communications Officer, officer in charge of a team that provides communications for the President and his staff while on trip sites, emergencies and disaster response locations. Interface with government and civilian agencies to obtain critical circuits. Provide intra-agencies coordination and communications with supporting agencies including the Secret Service, FBI and State Department. Officer in Charge of the Network Architecture Branch a Joint Service Agency; responsible for the operations and maintenance of the local and wide area networks that directly supports the President of the United States. Responsible for over 570 network devices, geographically dispersed around the world, valued over $100M dollars, provide 24 hour a day on demand support and network monitoring, fault isolation, and service restoration. Evaluate equipment, obtain quotes from vendors, conduct research, and complete ROM/BOM to meet the challenge of the ever evolving IT environment. Supervised personnel from all military branches and contractors, ensuring that 24 hour support needs are met and training on current and new equipment and procedures are conducted to keep the division on the cutting edge. Monitor 24/7 a robust network, manning critical Network Operations Center (NOC) with highly qualified personnel, reducing issues and outages. Planned, staffed, and conducted Authorized Service Interruptions to upgrade, install, and update equipment while maintaining user connectivity through rerouting of critical circuits.

title: Satellite Communication Station Chief; Battalion Network Manager; COMSEC
description: Officer in Charge, Lead Technician, Information Assurance Security Officer for a STEP satellite communications facility which provided world wide access to the Global Information Grid for critical secure communications to deployed and strategic customers. Engineered, Operated and Maintained Hurricane Katrina Relief, Drug Interdiction, and Home Land Defense communications missions. In support of XVIII Airborne Corps, Special Operations Command, Marines, Air Force, and Department of Homeland Security. Project lead in complete overhaul of site, replaced Uninterruptible Power Supply system for the compound, upgraded the SATCOM dish with all new waveguide, High Power Amplifiers, Bandwidth Efficient Modems, installed MIDAS system, MSPP, and upgraded Promina 800. Information Assurance, Security, Safety, Quality Control, and Environmental Compliance Officer. Designed and managed the Wide Area Network for two-thirds of South Korea. Completely overhauled aging copper infrastructure network dispersed from Pusan to Seoul South Korea. Monitored network 24/7 operations, managed and maintained a Class B public IP space, provided for strategic and remote user connections. Lauded for “Best COMSEC Account” in Korea during peninsula wide inspection. Responsible for users located throughout two thirds of South Korea, without incident. As Battalion Network Technician designed and implemented tactical networks to support the Commands needs through MSE, Microwave LOS and HCLOS, Satellite, Tropo-scatter, and DGM equipment. Programmed all the routers and switches, utilized taclanes to tunnel networks and services requested. Implemented satellite communications planning for XVIII Airborne Corps and supported units across the United States as X and EHF Frequency Manager. MILSTar Planners course graduate, lead largest tactical satellite platoon in the US Army with thirteen terminals and 57 soldiers, supported countless missions and rotations across the world.

summary: Certified Knowledge Management professional with over 20 years of IT and Project Management experience in the government and private sector. Customer-oriented leader with proven management, interpersonal, and communication skills, able to manage diverse work groups drawn from multiple disciplines and with varying skill levels. Successful record of planning and executing projects, translating business requirements and processes into creative solutions, reducing costly inefficiencies, with an ability to excel in high-pressure environments, bringing in projects on time and on budget. White House Communications Agency Executive Officer of the Network Systems Division. Retired Chief Warrant Officer 250NE3 Network Management and Satellite Communications Technician for the US Army, experience analyzing, designing, consulting, deploying and managing multi-million dollar IT projects and facilities. Specialties: Knowledge Management, Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft CRM, Defense Ready, ITIL, MBA, Information Systems, IT Management.

summary: My name is Grant Woodland, and worked as a Network Administrator for L-3 until the contract expired. Now I'm working with General Dynamics as a Senior Systems Technician. title: Network Infrastructure Engineer
description: As an expert level member of Planning and Design, I provide expert and specialized planning, engineering, design, and implementation of networking solutions and services in a data center environment for statewide and high-visibility IT initiatives for Consolidated Technology Services (CTS). Designing, installing, configuring, monitoring, and maintaining network and server infrastructure for a 40 server, 350 user multi location network. Duties include: • Migrating large enterprise services into a newly designed network infrastructure in the new State Data Center. • Performing as a professional and technical expert while consulting with customers and assisting with analysis, planning, design, and implementation of large, complex, statewide, mission critical internal and customer network projects. • Preparing technical network designs, project plans/timelines, and coordinating and directing installation of network circuits, hardware, and software to meet project timelines and provide project status information to project stakeholders. • Provide engineering and design solutions to include budgetary estimates for requested move, add, changes. • Performing cost analysis and establishing billing requirements for inter agency and customer IT products and services. • Performing technical troubleshooting and problem resolution for major state and agency-wide, high risk, high impact, and mission-critical networks. • Applies strategic goals of the Agency and advanced project management methodology to independently manage high risk, high impact mission critical projects. • Recommending processes and procedures for network project implementation and ongoing operational support. • Design, install, configure, monitor, and maintain Cisco routers, switches, firewalls, and related hardware.

title: Network Management Technician
description: Served as the Enterprise Network Manager in the Network Engineering section; designed, installed and managed Wide Area Networks (WANs) and Local Area Networks (LANs) consisting of 100 Nodes and about 15,000 users. Developed network policies, configured Routers and Switches and enforces security requirements in accordance with Information Assurance guidelines. Configured WAN and LAN equipment, such as Cisco ASA firewalls, Cisco Routers and Switches, Call Manager Express, Cisco Unified Call Managers, and Dynamic Multipoint Virtual Private Networks (Models 2800, 3500, 3700, 3800, 3900, 4500, and 6500). Provide network support for Division headquarters and remote sites, implementing network solutions that employ OSPF, EIGRP, spanning tree, Ethernet switching, HSRP and optical based network technologies. Provided support analyzing customer requirements and developing complex network designs and solutions throughout the Division and to remote organizations. Supervised and managed tactical switching communications equipment as well as the Network Operations (NETOPS) for the brigade. Planned, managed, and conducted troubleshooting Army, joint, and combined networks through the use of the Joint Network Node (JNN), Command Post Node (CPN), associated Warfighter Information Network - Tactical (WIN-T) equipment and Commercial of the Shelf (COTS) technology. Coordinated and synchronized brigade communications exercises and proficiency training. Managed electronic keys required to support signal networks. Developed policy recommendations and technical guidance for spectrum management of Command and Control (C2) systems, FM communications, line of sight (LOS) and omni-directional radios, and satellite communications.

title: Satellite Systems Manager / Information Assurance Security Manager / Network Operations Manager
description: Maintained current and future Satellite operation planning in and out of theater; set up Satellite access requests, Gateway access requests and created configuration cut sheets for the Soft Deployable Nodes. Oversaw the Group Support Battalion (GSB) TACLAN shop, which also included managing several personnel in numerous aspects of daily helpdesk services and computer trouble tickets as well as training and professional development. Performed Staff Assistance Visits prior to Command Inspection Program (CIP) that incorporated four Battalions; the GSB, and the Headquarters Headquarters Company (HHC), assistance provided resulted in 98% success grade. Managed the Command, Control, Communications and Cyber office, or J6 and all personnel through respective department heads including; Radio, TACLAN, JCSE and COMSEC. Served as the liaison between the J6 and command staff, ensuring dissemination of all communications related issues up and down the chain of command. Coordinated with Combined Forces Special Operations Command Joint Network Control Center on all Authorized Service Interruptions, Satellite Access Requests and Ground Access Request submissions and troubleshot between components and respective Standard Tactical Entry Point sites. Monitored, reported and requested multi-channel status changes and outages for over 160 separate circuits on eight different networks; processed and submitted Communication Status report to MNCI and CFSOCC-JNCC daily. Scheduled and maintained all video teleconferences, reviewed and approved Request for Service documentation submitted by Joint Communications Support Element. Focal point for reporting and requesting circuit changes on all Secure Internet Protocol Router, Non-Secure Internet Protocol Router, Defense Red Switch Network, Voice-Over-Internet-Protocol, Defense Switch Network services supporting the 3,000 members of CJSOTF-AP.

title: Satellite Systems Operator / Network Operations Manager
description: I planed and coordinated the installation of a major satellite communications solution. Supervised and performed the installation of communications outpost at Khabari Crossing, Kuwait. This solution consisted of the installation of one AN/USC-60A, 2.4 meter Tri-Band Satellite Terminal and an Integrated Digital Networking Exchange (IDNX) multiplexing system that provides Secure Internet Protocol Router, Non-Secure Internet Protocol Router, Releasable Internet Protocol Router Network, Voice-over-Internet Protocol, Defense Switch Network services. Operated and maintained all tech control facility equipment to include 2 – AN/GRC-239 Troop Satellite Support Radio (TSSR) radios, an IDNX Promina 800 node, Cisco router systems and wire frame equipment. Provided and maintained REMEDY action tickets and operational readiness reports for Track Authorized Service Interruptions (ASI’s) and Tasking Service Orders (TSO’s) scheduled Network outages and projected circuit installations for Camp Buehring Tech Control Facility.

title: Satellite Systems Supervisor
description: Provided guidance on technical issues for staff of ten personnel, maintained daily message log in accordance with Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) procedures and monitored and responded to more than 1,000 emergency calls. Maintained, handled and accounted for cryptographic materials and equipment, advised senior managers on alternative solutions to communications challenges and assisted in the installation, operation and maintenance of communications systems during numerous field-training exercises. Implemented daily operations, training and maintenance of three AN/GSC-52 satellite terminals, Digital Communications Satellite Subsystems (DCSS), four Spread Spectrum Multiple Access (SSMA) USC-28 modems, two Military Strategic and Tactical Relay (satellite) Command Post terminals, two Single Channel Transponder Injection Subsystem terminals, two Integrated Digital Network Exchange (IDNX) and associated equipment. Identified and reported electronic jamming and deception and applied appropriate electronic countermeasures; was accountable for Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA) and provided essential SATCOM to the President, Secretary of Defense, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Unified Combatant Commanders, Intelligence Community and multiple Federal Agencies through the Global Information Grid facility.

title: Logistics Analyst
description: Provide logistics support to the Digital Fires and Situational Awareness (DFSA) Program Office supporting the Target Location Designation Hand Off System (TLDHS) Project Office.Currently my role is to provide detailed analysis of the TLDHS program, by ensuring compliance with performance requirements, design functionality, and total life cycle supportability. I am instrumental in the development of all appropriate level documentation by using the most current DOD, DON and MCSC policies and directives. Responsibilities include developing fielding plans, life cycle support plans, item unique identification plans, maintenance plans, provisioning plans, man power & training plans, disposal plans, analysis reports, naval messages, configuration documentation. title: Functional Analyst
description: Provided Logistics support to Marine Corps System Command (MCSC) specifically the Advanced Field Artillery Tactical Data System (AFATDS) and Target Location Designation and Hand Off System (TLDHS) Project Offices. Assisted with the development of Fielding, Supportability, IUID, Disposal Plans, Man Power and Training Plans, Marine Stock List (SL-3) and Technical Manuals. Participated with drafting Naval Messages and Memorandum of Record (MOR) and Memorandum of Agreements (MOA’s). Participated with the Integrated Logistics Assessment (ILA's) resulting in successfully fielding decisions and achieving FOC for the AFATDS, Back Up Computer System (BUCS), Mobile Tactical Shelter (MTS) and TLDHS programs. Coordinated with Marine Corps Forces (MARFORS) relating to verification/establishment of KLIF accounts for EKMS CCI item tracking. Coordinated with industry integrators with shipping requirements for equipment and provided required support to the Operating Forces by conducting system fielding events. Provided logistics support for all follow on fielding evolutions by conducting Joint Inventories and Limited Technical Inspections (LTI’s). Provided subject matter expertise (SME) support working closely and collectively with the gaining units to ensure Marines were trained in the proper procedures involving vehicle preparation and installation processes relating to the fielding of the MTS.

title: Computer Systems Security Analyst Sr. Manager
description: •Managed security team of 8 Information Security Engineers providing support to various Department of Defense and Federal Government clients. •Collaborated with other department managers and provide assistance with developing responses to Information Security solicitations. •Trained various organizations for the United States Army on Communications Security (COMSEC) and other subjects related to Information Security. •Managed 9.9 million dollars of corporate revenue. •Supervised local office operations, responsible for direct support of corporate business objectives by developing new work and preparation of technical proposals and cost estimates for submission to potential customers. •Lead Information Security Engineer for all Certification and Accreditations efforts for various Program Manager Offices (PEOs) of the Department of the Army. •Served as Security Test Lead for all Automated Information Systems developed by the Product Director Intelligence Fusion (PDIF), Fort Belvoir VA.

title: Network Operations Manager
description: Deployed in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom 08-10 for 15 months; assigned teams provided reliable communications during wartime. Collaborated with coalition and Iraqi forces to provide an integrated communications solution. Performed architectural planning, management, and troubleshooting of a newly fielded mobile communications system. Led, trained and mentored two middle managers, two field service representatives and seven supervisors. Advised senior management on policy relating to the JNTCS mobile communications system.

description: Planned and executed a very complex multi-tiered Wide Area Network for the joint and combined Juniper Cobra (JC) 2007 exercise in the State of Israel. Collaborated with Joint US and Israeli forces to deploy and emplace a secure network over commercial and military infrastructure on ten (10) sites while negotiating physical and technical barriers to ensure security. Provided network connectivity for over 500 participants from joint and coalition forces. Supervised and integrated Army Battlefield Control Systems, Wide Area Networks, Local Area Networks and radio systems to execute the Brigade's mission in a deployed location.

title: Network Management Technician
description: During Operation Iraqi Freedom II, engineered and installed 6 Technical Control Facilities and a Network Operations center. Received Bronze Star medal recognizing superior Technical expertise and leadership. In collaboration with Higher Headquarters performed quality control of the Division’s network (provided IT services for over 22,000 personnel) continually implementing changes to improve its reliability and integrity. Provided technical training to over 500 soldiers with focus on optimum mission performance.

title: Supervisor Technical Control
company: Joint Communication Support Element, Tampa Florida
description: worked from operator to be chosen by 1SG to lead section, a position normally held by a SFC. Led 19 Technical Controllers to install the Hub of the largest Promina Network ever installed in a U.S. led Exercise (BRIGHT; consisting of 23 tactical Integrated Digital Network Exchange nodes, 125 circuits, and 50 trunks supporting 70,000 exercise participants from 9 coalition nations. Received impact award for outstanding performance during BS 01/02. Also received impact award during Fervent Archer for leading a team of 9 Joint Service personnel to relocate a Tactical Special Compartmentalized Information facility; provided the Chief of Staff with the communication infrastructure to support the Commander of the Stabilization Force. Trained 50 students on the Promina multi-service platform; saved government $75,000 in TDY expenses. NCO in Charge of Satellite Team

title: Senior Cryptographic Technician
description: Performed multiple duties for a special Joint Service unit. Developed a Joint Satellite Communications team from start to 100% mission capable in 4 months; 2 months ahead of schedule. Our maintenance team was responsible for 350 secure voice and data circuits; 19 IDNX nodes, 4 Wide Area Networks, and 2 secure radio networks, valued at $25 million, in nine facilities and numerous small sites located throughout Korea. Became certified as an Integrated Digital Network Exchange (IDNX) instructor. Trained 58 students from across Korea on the IDNX, saved government $232,000 dollars in TDY expenses. Completed 900 hours of CBT training on Information Technology. Received impact award for ULCHI FOCUS LENS 98. Received Joint Service Commendation Medal for services rendered to the unit.

title: Member Technical Staff
description: Lead Support Engineer for Circuit and Data Switching Systems in South Korea - EKIP SMU, TTC-39D and TYC-39A. Repsonsible for strategic network architecture design on the EKIP SMU project, with direct support for DSN and DISN connectivity. Managed all system wide upgrades, hardware and software enhancements. Directly responsible for Technical Sales totaling $5M over the life of the contract. Additional duties included the conduct of three annual NNMC (Network Nodal Management Courses) to US Army customers; each course was three weeks in duration.

title: Hardware Support Engineer
description: Hardware Support Engineer for PDSS, Ft. Monmoth, NJ; TRI-TAC (TTC-39 and TYC-39) early model tactical systems. The scope of this position involved daily maintenance of all laboratory systems connected to the TRI-TAC equipment, IBM 4300 vacumn tape drives, IBM 1494 punch card readers, DSTE, Chicago and Keinschmidt teletypes, custom hardware support for magnetic tape replication systems using 9 track NRZ Genisco tape drives. The scope of this job involved component level repairs as necessary to maintain the laboratory equipment; CRT monitors, MILTOPE helix line printers and Genisco Magnetic Tape Drives.

title: Chief, JIE Capabilities and Implementation Division
company: DISA/ Joint Information Environment (JIE) Implementation Office
description: Responsible for coordinating, and directing DISA JIE Implementation Office (JIO) efforts and activites. Directs and develops strategy, plans and policy, effects coordination within DISA on JIE functions, integrates and implements JIE information technology and service capabilities in order to provide the warfighter with a single, secure, defensible network, and thereby deliver increased mission effectiveness across the DoD Information Network (DoDIN). Coordinates MiTRE resources in developing key artifacts and technological deliverables to facilitate JIE developement.

description: Directed IT programs and future capability development for Defense Support to Civilian Authorities missions. title: Commander
description: Led a Strategic/Tactical Signal Battalion with 450 soldiers, consisting of 4 companies that provided command and control communications systems and information systems for critical operations in SouthWest Asia, Central/South Amercica and CONUS. Led and executed simultaneous support for three Combatant Commanders (CENTCOM, SOUTHCOM and NORTHCOM) with satellite communications, C2 networks and C4IT infrastructure installation capabilities. Installed, operated, and maintained critical global communication links and information capabilities for mulit-national forces and operations. Trained and deployed IT soldiers In Support Of (ISO) Iraqi Freedom; ISO of SOUTHCOM’s missions into Columbia, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Honduras and the Stabilization Mission into Haiti; and ISO of several training exercises for USNORTHCOM’s burgeoning Defense Support to Civil Agencies Missions. Implemented leadership training programs for over 25 officers, and 150 Non-commissioned officers that highlighted and strengthened leadership, mentorship, respect and standards. This focus on value oriented leadership was key to the operational development and readiness of each soldier assigned to the unit.

title: Chief, MCCC Operations
description: Responsible for all aspects of policy, direction, planning, operations, security, communications, battle staff procedures and training for the Commander in Chief ,US Space Command (CINCSPACE) Mobile Alternate Headquarters. Supported mission requirements of the National Command Authorities (NCA), Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD), Chairman, Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS), and CINC North American Aerospace Defense (NORAD). Represented the CINC on DoD, Joint Staff, Air Force Space Command operations, requirements, testing and survivability working groups. Developed training programs that verified the C4 reliability and MCCC staff to support CINCSPACE throughout the spectrum of conflict. Led the Survival Mobile Command Center community in identifying vulnerabilities in operations, security, information warfare, and force protection. Planned, developed, and implemented the modernization of the MCCC platform which resulted in significantly improved capabilities and survivability. Key contributor to revision of National policy and directives in the areas of nuclear command and control and space operations.

title: Executive Officer
description: Synchronized and provided oversight to a general staff and C4I organization comprised of over 550 individuals in support of military operations on the Korean Peninsula. Executed Commander’s guidance, military activities, tasks and assigned command and control missions. Planned and executed all support functions to ensure the readiness posture of the unit by aligning all administrative, logistical and maintenance functions against the operational communication networks mission. Established an organizational mentorship program that developed for over 100 junior officers in all aspects of leadership and professionalism. Planned and tested procedures that ensured the safety of over 500 family members during emergencies. Developed new procedures that improved data reliability, information flow and decision making. Coordinated with Department of Army that ensured SATCOM and circuit switches equipment upgrades.

title: Operations Officer/Theater C4I Planner
description: Planned, resourced and implemented IFOR’s first ever operational communications network in support of NATO’s operational deployment to the former Yugoslavia. Coordinated with Multinational Forces, French, British and American for C4I requirements and ensured network connectivity between French Headquarters in Mostar, British Headquarters in Banja Luka, American Forces in Tuzla and NATO Headquarters in Sarejevo. Planned, and coordinated the resourcing of NATO’s first ever UHF satellite network for operational use in military operations. Established a theater wide wideband satellite communications backbone/network that dramatically improved situational awareness and multinational operational synergy. Coordinated with all NATO representatives to ensure allocation of satellite resources, procurement and operational network support for the IFOR mission. Oversaw the implementation of the theater communications network ensuring C4I reliability, readiness and operational support.

title: Signal Officer - S6
description: Battalion S-6 of an 1800 Soldier, Combat Sustainment Support Battalion capable of providing force sustainment in support of joint and coalition forces in theaters of operational conflicts. Responsible for the operation and maintenance of all tactical and strategic communications assigned to the battalion. Plans, develops and integrates any and all C4OPS within the battalion. Prepares maintenance and updates communications operations estimates, plans, orders and standard operating procedures for the battalion. Coordinates with Network Enterprise Center and contractors to manage the information network, obtain required services and support mission requirements. Advises the battalion commander, staff and subordinate commanders, on communications, information operations and network priorities for command and control. Responsible for morale, welfare professional growth, training, safety and overall readiness of two Lieutenants, one Warrant Officer and fifteen Soldiers

title: Battle Captain
description: Regional Network Operations and Security (RNOSC) Battle Captain of a forward stationed theater signal battalion; providing command and control communications throughout Afghanistan, Iraq and Qatar in direct support of USCENTCOM forward headquarters, NATO International Security Assistance Force, CJTF-101, Combined Security Transition Command - Afghanistan, and Army Support Group - Qatar. Provides staff coordination between three geographically separated companies while ensuring 160th Signal Brigade, 335th Theater Signal Command, NETCOM, and Warfighter communications objectives are met. Responsible for the health, morale and welfare of four military and fifteen civilian personnel

title: Defense Switched Network(DSN)/Defense Red Switch Network(DRSN) Network Operations Center Chief
description: Direct operation of 70 DSN, 12 DRSN switches/services valued at over $750 million; manages and supervises 39 General Dynamics contractors who provide secure/non-secure voice, data and video teleconference services for the pacific Global Information Grid (GIG) supporting C4I requirements for the PACOM, USFK, USFJ, USARPAC, MARFORPAC, COMPACFLT and PACAF Commanders; provides daily Network Operations (NETOPS) situational awareness to the DISA-PAC Commander.

title: Director National Broadband Network Australia
description: Director NBN Co Program responsible for development, integration, test, production, construction and deployment of 10 RF Gateways including two 13 meter Ka band antennas and baseband equipment at each site, 2 Data Processing Centers, User Terminals and Antennas, Ground System Test Bed in Australia and Software System including comprehensive integrated NMS, OSS, Access Network Software System for Australian NBN Co program valued at over $260M. Size of program demanded Significant Chief Operating Officer leadership role and responsibility over greater than 300 personnel at over fifteen geographic sites driving successful execution and achievement of cost, schedule and performance objectives. Managed successful verification of over 1200 requirements in over 500 witnessed tests and analysis. Delivered 4 major software deliveries to the National Broadband Network Company Australia and supported in country testing at the Australian National Test Facility. Leading in country systems integration coordination with multiple divisions of NBN Co, Ericsson and ViaSat and guiding pre and post satellite launch planning and execution of program to enable successful customer deployment in Australia. Developing comprehensive training courses, operations and maintenance procedures for NBN Co. Managed development, integration, test and production of Modems, 3W and 6W TRIAs, 80, 120 and 180cm Antennas and Power Supplies with first deliveries to NBN Co completed on schedule involving domestic and international vendors and expect over $250M in sales over life of program. Program involves multiple ViaSat divisions and locations including both domestic and international development partners. Implemented Equipment Related Support Services plan for 5 years of support to NBN Co implemented. Largest program in the history of ViaSat.

title: Director Multifunctional Information Distribution System Joint Tactical Radio System (MIDS JTRS)
description: Director of the Multifunctional Information Distribution System Joint Tactical Radio System (MIDS JTRS) responsible for co-opetition of Link-16 development between ViaSat and Data Link Solutions, integration, test, production, installation and completion of First Article Qualification Testing, Security Verification Testing for Communications Security Approval from the National Security Agency, Air Worthiness Certification, Electromagnetic Compatibility Features, Software Communications Architecture compliance and deliver production RADIOS to the F/A-18E/F and E-8C Joint Stars aircraft including successful completion of F/A-18E/F and Joint STARS Aircraft Operational Test & Evaluation resulting in combat deployment in U.S. Navy and U.S. Air Force aircraft. summary: Over thirty five years of executive level leadership and hands-on experience in successfully delivering both Commercial and Government Domestic and International programs while achieving cost, schedule and performance objectives. Handpicked to lead all critical and strategic programs at ViaSat for over 10 years. Proven track record of exceptionally high performance in Space Ground Systems, Government Mobile Satellite Communications, Commercial Aviation WIFI, Joint, Coalition and Naval Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Combat Systems and Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C5ISR) programs and systems engineering management in roles equating to COO, Director, Program Manager and CIO responsibilities. • Ran the end to end Satellite internet project for the Australian government National Broadband service • Completed biggest commercial satellite ground system project in company’s history worth $250M • Deployed SATCOM and services to US and Allied Military aircraft and General Aviation aircraft • Implemented fastest Ka Satellite Wifi into JetBlue and United Aircraft including FAA certification • Ran MIDS JTRS Radio program and qualified in F/A-18 and Joint STARs aircraft was largest military project worth $170M • Led MIDS LVT Radio domestic and international business development • Chief of Staff for Chief Engineer SPAWARSYCOM • CIO Military for SPAWARSYSCOM deployed NMCI • PM for MIDS LVT led operational qualification in F/A-18 • Commanding Officer Naval Aircraft E-2 and ES-3 manufacturing and F-14, F-18, A-6, EA-6 & E-2 depot maintenance • Test Pilot F-14D, Fighter Squadron Leadership Extensive knowledge in all facets of financial and acquisition management with a proven record of achieving the highest levels of productivity, efficiency, strategic planning and problem solving. Principal technical advisor, strong team builder and persuasive communicator with exceptional organizational and interpersonal skills.

title: Operations Officer Tactical Aircraft Programs for NAVAIRSYSCOM at SPAWARSYSCOM
company: Program Executive Officer Tactical Aircraft Naval Air Systems Command
description: Captain U.S. Navy, Operations Officer, Tactical Aircraft Programs, PEO Tactical Aircraft, NAVAIRSYSCOM at SPAWARSYSCOM San Diego Single point of contact between PEOT, NAVAIR and SPAWAR to eliminate technical challenges to international Multifunctional Information Distribution System (MIDS) Data Link system. Accomplishments: • Led MIDS Terminal Integration Maturity Review Team to successful correction of TACAN, Mission Computer, Integration Protection Fault, Software and Built-in-Test deficiencies which enabled completion of developmental flight testing and commencement of final Operational Evaluation. • Forged an alliance between Government organizations and two MIDS industry suppliers to recover a seven month schedule slip and enable a second MIDS vendor to complete development of its first production terminals and commencement of F/A-18 Flight test. Preserving industry competition acquisition strategy resulted in 35% reduction in cost of MIDS from Lot I to Lot II for one vendor

title: Deputy Program Manager, International Tactical Data Links
company: Program Executive Officer Tactical Aircraft, Naval Air Systems Command
description: Captain U.S. Navy, Deputy Program Manager, International Tactical Data Links, PEO Tactical Aircraft, NAVAIRSYSCOM at SPAWARSYSCOM San Diego Directed Systems Engineering, Configuration and Data Management for $500 million Multifunctional Information Distribution System Low Volume Terminal (MIDS LVT) ACAT ID International and Joint Data Link (Link-16) program involving 6 nations, 27 platforms, 3 U.S. services and multiple U.S. and European contractors guiding over 100 people. Accomplishments: • Handpicked by PEO to lead Red Team made up of 100 people from NAVAIR, SPAWAR, PEO(T), NAWC, MIDS PMO and International Industry to correct technical deficiencies in MIDS performance in F/A-18. Eliminated all major deficiencies, passed operational evaluation and awarded first production contract. U.S. Navy, U.S. Air Force and Allied Aircraft and U.S. Army forces are equipped with combat proven Link-16 MIDS LVT because of the success of this program. • Coordinated international repair of malfunctioning engineering terminal shop replacement units, which reduced shortage of test terminals from 30 to 5 and average one year repair cycle to one month. This enabled F/A-18, F-16, Eurofighter software development and aircraft integration and flight test programs to achieve testing schedules. • Developed and completed Operational Evaluation of the MIDS LVT2 and commenced production for U.S. Army Patriot Missile Batteries significantly improving situational awareness and Air-Land integration and coordination on the battle field.

title: Commanding Officer, Defense Plant Representative Office
company: Defense Contract Management Agency & Defense Logistics Agency
description: Commanding Officer, Defense Plant Representative Office Northrop Grumman, St. Augustine FL, Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA) & Defense Logistics Agency (DLA). Managed 850 government, civilian and industry personnel and 39 contracts valued at $1billion dollars performing aircraft production, modification and flight test of E-2C, F-14A/B, EA-6B, A-6, ES-3A, A-10 and E-8C Joint Stars, Navy, Air Force aircraft. Accomplishments: • Rated number one DPRO by NAVAIR for three-year accident free flight test performance, delivering 492 aircraft ahead of schedule, 50 consecutive E-2C aircraft without a major discrepancy and saving $1 million in contract costs. Received best ever DLA safety and flight test inspection. • Instituted total quality management with joint government and industry team, which reduced one month cost estimation process to five days producing a 75% savings of time and reduction in labor costs. • Completed 1st ever Joint STARS E-8C modification and delivered to U.S. Air Force and airdcrft deployed to Gulf War. • Modified S-3 aircraft into ES-3A aircraft on schedule and delivered to U.S. Navy. • Test Pilot Flight tested manufactured and re-manufactured aircraft.

title: F-14 Flight Test and Program Officer
company: Naval Air Warfare Center Weapons Division, Naval Air Systems Command
description: F-14 Flight Test and Program Officer, Naval Aircraft Warfare Center Weapons Division, Point Mugu, CA. Directed 90 engineers, 9 F-14 Test Pilots and $197.7 million dollar budget. Test Pilot. Managed Development, Test & Evaluation of all F-14A/B/D software and hardware, Infrared Search and Track System, F-14D Weapon Separation and APG-71. Accomplishments: • Led multifunctional team review and improvement of software development and flight test processes which corrected six month delay in delivery of F-14D software and saved $500,000 in cost over runs. Combined developmental and operational flight test to achieve 30% increase in productivity. • Project leader whose perseverance guided F-14D Aircraft Navy Test Team through most demanding developmental technical evaluation in Pacific Missile Test Center history, resulting in 147 sorties and 12 successful missile shoots in 30 days eliminating one month schedule slip to complete testing on time. Resulted in successful F-14D OPEVAL and first deployment of F-14D with advanced weapon system, advanced Radar, Infrared Search and Track System, digital avionics, JTIDS Link-16 capability and improved engines and flight operations profile.

title: F-14 Aerospace Engineering Duty Officer and Test Pilot
company: U.S. Navy Test Pilot School, CFAEWINGPAC, VF 124 and VF 211
description: Aerospace Engineering Duty Officer, F-14 Naval Test Pilot Officer. NAS Patuxent River U.S. Naval Test Pilot School graduate. Designed F-14D aircrew syllabus and managed delivery of 500 training deliverables used to develop computer based training system. F-14 Tactics leader. F-14 Fleet Replacement Squadron Instructor in VF124. Fighter Squadron VF211 Administrative Department Head, Line and Aircraft Division Officer Positions directing the safe operation, maintenance and supervision of fighter aircraft and personnel. title: Senior Project Manager
description: I provide professional engineering and construction management services for the design and construction of Federal Facilities. Perform as senior coordinator and planner for Genesis Program stationing activities. Provide oversight and guidance to other Genesis Station Project Leaders supporting INSCOM major subordinate command’s stationing projects and studies. Perform quality assurance reviews of all stationing documentation prior to submittal to the Government. Coordinate stationing action tasks with the INSCOM G4 engineering staff on basing requirements associated with the training, organization, and sustainment of US Army Military Intelligence activities and their related missions. Provides facility planning and installation master planning support relating to contract supported units at worldwide locations. I work with other Government and Contractor engineers to perform Facility Planning Program tasks. Investigate and determine facility requirements relating to unit relocations, realignment, transfer and equipment de-installation/installation. Determines the most efficient utilization of available facilities for operation of mission systems/equipment. Provides cost estimates and programming data in support of such moves. Assists with preparation of documentation required by AR 5-10 or other MILCON regulations. Provides technical advice and guidance to Government engineers and military construction programmers in investigating infrastructure, facility space and utility system shortfalls and structural requirements, and in coordinating the work of other engineering disciplines to produce the required functional outcome. Reviews Government furnished reports, studies, master plans and facility requests to identify deficiencies. Provides comments in the planning and programming of construction, renovation, repair, and redesign efforts by the Government.

title: Deputy Program Manager for Facilities and Support
description: The DPMFS maintains weapons qualifications and is responsible for assignment and allocation of housing, and program support elements. Plan, design, and manage buildings and grounds in addition to people. Responsible for coordinating /developing physical work spaces with personnel and the functions work of the organization. Duties relating to operations and maintenance, housing compound, project planning and management, communication, quality assessment, facility function, technology integration, and management of human and environmental factors. Tasks within these broad categories include space and workplace planning, budgeting, leases management, renovations, or facility planning and design. Provides oversight of renovation projects, ranging from improving efficiency to ensuring that facilities meet government regulations and environmental, health, and security standards. Monitor the facility to ensure that it remains safe, secure, and well-maintained. Responsible for directing staff, logistics, IT support, vehicles, safety, medical assessments and treatment, and equipment and coordinate with Operations Section.

title: Facilities Engineer
description: I am the Contracting Officers Representative (COR) for all service and construction contracts. I review contract deliverable cost engineering products including cost estimates and risk assessments produced by independent third party Architectural & Engineering cost engineers. Provide professional service for reliability engineering and guidance by reviewing and analyzing project packages for content, design, constructability, risk analysis, reliability maintenance and all cost engineering matters related to Real Estate and Property Management, Design and Engineering, Construction Management, Historic Preservation, Security Management Acquisitions and Logistics Management and Area Management. Conduct technical reviews, evaluate project solicitations, proposals, quotes, and proposed change requests, and review and approve shop drawings and submittals. I research Department criteria, housing standards and historical costs to support development of budget estimates for projects and project safety requirements.

title: Construction Program Analyst
description: I am the technical expert in construction cost management and cost engineering services. I provide cost engineering advice and analysis on a comprehensive construction program for worldwide Overseas Building Operations (OBO). I prepare budget estimates for individual projects within the program range in value from minor projects of approximately $100 Thousand to major capital projects over $700 Million for NEC’s. I am the Contracting Officers Representative (COR) for all service and construction contracts. I review contract deliverable cost engineering products including cost estimates and risk assessments produced by independent third party Architectural & Engineering cost engineers for NEC’s. I provide professional service and guidance by reviewing and analyzing project packages for content, design, constructability, risk analysis and all cost engineering matters related to Real Estate and Property Management, Design and Engineering, Construction Management, Historic Preservation, Security Management Acquisitions and Logistics Management and Area Management. I review decommissioning and disposal cost estimates for a world-wide inventory of real property assets due for decommissioning and disposal. I served as Branch Chief for the Capital Projects and Team Leader for the Non-Capital branch. I research Department criteria, housing standards and historical costs to support development of budget estimates for projects. Conduct technical reviews, evaluate project solicitations, proposals, quotes, and proposed change requests, and conduct pre-bid and pre-construction site visits. I manage the IPRA (International Project Risk Assessment) program and facilitating IPRA team meetings for all projects in OBO.

title: Property Manager
description: I managed fourteen Federal facilities for GSA Region 10. The facilities are the U.S. Federal Courthouse, Spokane WA, the U.S. Post Office, Spokane, WA, the U.S. Federal Building, Colville, WA, U.S. Federal Courthouse, Coeur D’ Alene, ID, U.S. Federal Building, Sandpoint, ID, U.S. Border Patrol Sector Headquarters, Spokane WA and seven U.S. Border Stations located on the Canadian border. I supervise all building maintenance, janitorial and administrative staff and manage all service and maintenance contracts and project safety compliance. I develop and promote positive working relationships with the customer agencies and client personnel by maintaining a continuous liaison with building tenants and top management officials of customer agencies and tenants at the facilities managed, as well as similar relationships within GSA. I manage all for facilities operations to include providing professional service for reliability engineering and guidance by reviewing and analyzing project packages for content, design, constructability, risk analysis, reliability maintenance and all cost engineering matters related to security, operating budget, environmental protection, maintenance and repair, facilities projects, historic preservation, courthouse and border station programs, construction services and project management, statement of work, and serve as the Contracting Officer Technical Representative (COTR) on janitorial, maintenance, mechanical and other building service contracts. I conduct regular Security Board meetings with high level client representatives for Federal agencies, including Judges of the Federal Judiciary, Senators, Congressional representatives, U.S. Customs, U.S. Immigration and Naturalization Service, U.S. Marshall, U.S. Attorney other public officials, business persons and the general public on any matter involving GSA programs and activities within the buildings managed.

title: Base Civil Engineer
description: I supervised and managed the Base Civil Engineer and Wing Environmental Management Office/Bioenvironmental operations for the Louisiana Air National Guard (LA ANG), which included the 159th Fighter Group and three Geographically Separated Units. Prepared all contract drawings and specifications for civil engineering construction projects. I reviewed all Architectural & Engineering (A&E) plans and specifications for each project and coordinated design review conferences with the user and the National Guard Bureau. Prepared all A&E contract negotiation documents. I lead the staff in assessing its strengths and weaknesses and provide leadership to the teams in exploring alternatives and determining what improvements can be made. I serve as an expert analyst or advisor on the evaluation of the effectiveness of programs and operations and the productivity and efficiency of management. This includes implementing, coordinating, and overseeing a variety of complex management programs impacting the agencies activities; planning and/or conducting broad and in-depth special studies; developing and/or evaluating policies in assigned areas of responsibility; designing and coordinating planning activities; developing, implementing, and monitoring sophisticated management information systems; preparing and/or providing briefings and presentations on analytical findings and recommendations. I direct the development of new and/or changes to existing issuances and directives; determining the applicability and effect of new or proposed legislation, executive orders, agencies directives, and other agency decisions on organizational operations, managerial programs and requirements and units and project safety compliance.

description: To travel to various sites and setup the network infrastructure needed based on user occupancy. Installation and configuration of Cisco 2960 & 3560 switches, Cisco 1310 & 1410, Motorola Canopy and mikrotik bridges. Asset network configuration and alter optimize network layout. This includes changing bridges to AP's with omni directional antennas to allow further yagi antenna bridges more bandwidth to its users. Installed, setup and management of Windows Server 2008 for shared drive access using RMS to ensure clearance based information stay'd secure. Assembly and disassembly of 2.4 and 3.8 meter VSAT Dish along with configuration of iDirect 5000 series and Paradise 25 modems. Setup and maintenance of Printer Server and printers. Among other task were of troubleshoot, repair and upgrade of Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, and OSX desktop/laptops. Selected Contributions:  Created and upkeep of Network Topology with MS Visio and MS Excel tools of over 50 cisco switches, bridges and firewalls.  Setup and use of Solarwinds and wireshark to monitor network traffic and activity.  Standardized Cisco configuration files and create SOP documents on how to properly execute the installation of a Cisco environment network infrastructure.

title: VoIP Technical Support
description: Provide Technical support on consumer network configuration and setup process for Vonage VoIP devices via call center. Explain step-by-step instructions on port forwarding personal routers and firewalls to allow Vonage device to work through TCP and UDP ports. Advice customers of network configuration to better suit their needs. Change of VoIP packetization to allow lower bandwidth usage from vonage devices. Selected Contributions:  Handled over 60 calls per day with exceptional customer service and a first call resolution of over 87% on average.  Help beta test the telework/work from home option successfully.

title: Manager – Engineering Project Management
description: • Supervised the Transmission Engineering Project Management Group, comprised of seven project managers, to build out the e.spire infrastructure network. • Provided supervision, guidance, direction, accountability, training, and evaluations for the group. • Assigned projects for the planning, procuring, implementing installation, and turn up of transmission network equipment. • Provided analysis of proposed projects that included costs, schedule estimates, developing scope of work, tasks, duration, requisition parts lists, managing of budgets, and tasking cross-functional groups to accomplish project task to completion. title: Senior VP - Operations
description: MacB Enterprise Solutions, Inc. (MacB-ESI), Senior Vice President - Operations July 2008 - March 2014  Profit and Loss responsibility for a $40M business segment affiliated with MacAulay-Brown, Inc., a leading National Security company providing innovative engineering and technical solutions to Defense, Intelligence, Homeland Security and Federal agencies.  Responsible for the daily operations of all MacB-ESI client site personnel located across the US, Alaska, and Hawaii. This included overseeing all contracts, their performance, staffing, problem resolution, and customer satisfaction  Responsible for new business pipeline; principal proposal author, and lead pricing strategist.  Instrumental in transitioning over 100 employees from Ft. Monmouth, NJ to Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD as a result of the 2005 Base Realignment and Closure (BRAC) Act. Sytex, Inc./Lockheed Martin, Inc., Senior Director, Business Operations October 2004 – July 2008  Responsible for managing a team of business finance, planning, and contracts professionals ensuring contractual compliance, cost management, budget development and analyses, financial estimating, and proposal support.  Managed the administrative functions supporting a group of over 300 full-time associates; updated, and administered the operating budget and capital equipment budgets for the Group; tracked and coordinated responses to requests for proposals issued by Government agencies; and directed overall proposal development.  Negotiated the transition of some 220 employees from Lockheed Martin to MacB Enterprise Solutions, Inc. The acquisition of the business group by Lockheed Martin put these individuals and Lockheed Martin in an Organizational Conflict of Interest (OCI) position. Management convinced Lockheed to allow all employees to move to MacB-ESI in exchange for contractual considerations.
