title: Proposal Writer/Staffing Manager
description: • Expertise in providing guidance on evaluating Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and Statements of Work (SOW) for personnel and resume requirements. Train staffing managers and resume leads on requirements and processes. • Responsible for overall staffing on proposals; largest efforts supported included staffing over 650 full time equivalents (FTEs) across 25 teammate companies. Screen candidates from recruiting to determine if their qualifications and clearances qualify for proposal job categories and levels. Determine which candidates receive Letters of Intent. Prepare staffing matrices for proposal delivery. • Managed a team of six staff during a 7-week effort writing 700+ resumes. Responsible for daily workload and tracking of all files with constantly changing candidates. • Develop proposal templates and matrices for resumes, staffing, personnel skills, and past performance that comply with RFP Section L and M requirements. • Write and tailor resumes. Interview candidates to ensure all requirements are addressed. • Validate matching and consistent staffing data appear across resumes, staffing, security, and cost volumes of proposals. • Write past performance volumes. Prepare, distribute, and track past performance questionnaires. Ensure that all past performance data is approved in accordance with Non-Publicity/Non-Disclosure Clauses. • Created division Editing Style Guide. Led proposal editors and writers in working together to align common style and identity standards. • Edit proposals, marketing material, and briefings for consistency, clarity, and compliance. • Work with Capture and Proposal Managers to create outlines, compliance matrices, and schedules.

title: Network Analyst
description: •Supports the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Command Duty Officer (CDO) in the Global Network Operations Center to maintain 24x7 situational awareness of relevant intelligence information concerning threats across the global DoDIN, Enterprise Service architecture, and supporting Data Centers •Provides mission assurance direction in the defense of the DoDIN to assure timely and secure net-centric capabilities across strategic, operational, and tactical boundaries in support of DoD's full spectrum of war fighting, intelligence, and business missions •Provides incident handling/triage, analysis and trends, vulnerability assessments, malware queries, and security posture dissemination for the entire DISA spectrum •Participates in intelligence and NetOps briefing, video teleconferences and other collaborative forums on matters relevant to the agerncy’s mission in defense of the DoDIN •Monitors information provided to DISA for evidence of unauthorized or malicious activity and attack; provides notification to the CDO and ensures coordination of information with DISA Command Center and other global mission assurance personnel •Assists in populating, modifying, and updating the data in the Joint Threat Incident Database (JTID) and the Joint Threat Intelligence Portal (JTIP) •Responsible for providing liaison to USCYBERCOM, DHS/US CERT, IC-IRC, NSA Threat Operation Center (NTOC) and various other network defense entities on global network defense issues •Tracks and analyzes Authorized Service Interruption (ASI) information gathered about DISA networks, services, and data centers.

title: Systems Control Officer / Dynamic Network Defense Operations
description: •Served as a direct liaison between USCYBERCOM Joint Operations Center and various government agencies and Combatant Commands, Services, Agencies and Field Activities (CC/S/A/FAs) for the management, tracking and reporting of all Department of Defense Information Network (DODIN) assets, which include satellite communications, Optical Transport Networks (OTNs) and all other DISN services that support the warfighter worldwide. •Participated in Intelligence and NetOps video teleconferences and other collaborative forums on matters relevant to the command's mission in defense of the DODIN. •Ensured cyberspace defense of the DODIN partnering with NSA and DISA to develop mitigation of cyber advisories and unauthorized network access attempts. •Employed various on-site tools to monitor and analyze system outages. •Monitored Authorized Service Interruptions (ASIs) and the effects of the maintenance across the DODIN. •Coordinated DODIN Operations issues with the DODIN Mission Lead, the DISA Support Element (DSE), the Global SATCOM Support Center, and the COCOM/Service Network Operations Centers. •Analyzed outages and provided expert recommendations to Mission Lead / Cyber Battle Captain. •Updated and provided daily DODIN operations briefing slides for senior leadership brief. •Monitored DOD networks and systems to detect vulnerabilities and malicious activity. •Reviewed information in Vulnerability Management System (VMS) to report agencies which had open assets, and reported agencies who had not updated their Plan of Actions and Milestone (POAMs). •Notified appropriate Services and Agencies for tracking and remediation of any DOD Network issues. •Coordinated the tracking and compliance of vulnerability mitigation across the DOD Network •Provided daily updates to the various services and agencies on the status of network operations •Coordinated between the different Services and Agencies to deconflict friendly activity on the network

title: Senior Intelligence Operations Analyst (Watch Officer)
description: •Provided timely technical information in a 24/7 Intelligence Operations Center which assisted in current operations and status of globally deployed personnel. •Provided situational awareness of worldwide events and activities and daily operational updates that affected the Intelligence Community (IC), the Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) and its subordinate organizations. •Provided written and oral assessments as required to the operational staff on various aspects of unit operations. •Provided operational coordination for INSCOM G3 taskings to the Major Subordinate Commands (MSCs) units in order to support the general warfighting effort. •Monitored Area of Interest and reported on current world events. •Monitored classified systems (i.e. JWICS, SIPRnet, etc.) as well as AMHS and WAMS for information that affected INSCOM or its MSCs. •Utilized computer systems and other information technology to search for current intelligence and updated databases via various classified systems. •Prepared current intelligence assessments and operational briefings at the agency level for INSCOM and Army Staff and Senior Officials from the National Foreign Intelligence Community. •Provided quality control in preparation of Read Books, briefing materials and information papers; ensured these items were delivered in a timely and accurate manner. •Provided advice and assistance during emergency recovery and other Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP).

title: Satcom Engineer
description: Assisted in troubleshooting and restoration of a fifteen node Demand Assigned Multiple Access VSAT network utilizing SSE Technologies 150 watt power amplifiers, Comtech up/down converts, Xicom 1000 watt solid state power amplifiers, Andrews parabolic antennas, and ViaSat satellite equipment controlled by a Window NT Server workstation running proprietary ViaSat Network Control System (NCS) software to provide on demand data and voice access via PABX using E&M signaling type 5. As a subject matter expert, provided knowledge of satellite communications, local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), and voice/data communications to develop vocational training and hands on training curriculum for the Royal Saudi Air Force.

title: Hardware Technician
description: As of October 2000, assumed operation and maintenance duties of Global Broadcast Service (GBS) terminal to include KG-75 FASTLANE, two Microsoft NT server 4.0 workstations (classified/unclassified environments), receive only Ka/Ku receive-only satellite tracking antenna, and Tadiran video decoders. Engineered transition of Optivision MPEG decoders to Tadiran MPEG decoders in include embedded serial data streams for local distribution. Operated, maintained, and modified Xicom 500 watt multiband power amplifiers, 100 watt SSE Technologies transceivers, and very small aperture terminals (VSAT) providing communication links utilizing FORE Systems Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) ASX-200BX switch, Powerhub 7000 Local Area Network Emulation (LANE), and California Microwave EF data modems running at T1and 2xT1 to provide high capacity information transfer over a satellite network. Maintain an OC-3 ATM link to the Pentagon. Ensured that all Local Area Networks (LAN) have connectivity to the WAN. Installed and troubleshot fiber optic transceivers, computer hubs, and cabling to ensure LAN and WAN connectivity to VSAT network. Operated and maintained the Joint Broadcast System receive suite, which provides numerous information products over a receive-only satellite link and run on a Sun UNIX platform with associated video decoders and LAN. Performed basic system administration of Sun Microsystems Sparc UNIX workstation and RAID servers running Sybase to include system backups, checking error logs, and ensuring proper system operation.

title: Communication Technician
description: Operated and maintained the AN/GSC-49 jam resistant secure satellite communication terminal which included two redundant 1000 watt klystron amplifiers, and its associated AN/USC-28 spread spectrum code division multiple access (CDMA) modem, Canoga Perkins fiber optic modems, and AN/FCC-100 low rate multiplexers in accordance with Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA)/ Air Force (AF) regulations. Configured and maintained Timeplex Link/2 multiplexer, NET IDNX 20, and survivable communications integration system (SCIS) VAX computer running on a VMS operating system interfaced with users via a Ethernet and network communication servers. Performed routine operations on VAX computer to involve basic system administration and data backup. Performed circuit testing and troubleshooting long haul circuit commercial data and voice circuits utilizing a patch and test facility to isolate circuits and facilitate circuit restoral.

description: Configured, maintained, and operated satellite tracking ground station in accordance with DISA, NASA, and AF regulations. title: Satellite Wideband Communications Journeyman
description: Routinely performed digital data rate tests utilizing Harris and Fireberd data test sets on terminal equipment operating at up to a T1 rate to ascertain thresholds and performance. Adjusted equipment that failed performance tests to meet requirements. Installed, maintained, modified, and operated numerous types of wideband (microwave) and satellite earth terminal communication systems (fixed and mobile) in accordance with military regulations. Terminal equipment consisted of various models of air cooled klystrons, liquid cooled traveling wave tubes, fiber optic modems, TDMA/FDMA multiplexers, phase shift keying modems, frequency up/down converters, antenna synchro/servos, frequency standards, high power transmitters, low noise amplifiers, power supplies, encryption devices, and fault monitoring/switching units. Troubleshot system-wide problems down to equipment level to restore communications with a minimum amount of circuit downtime. Routinely ordered replacement parts through the supply system and accomplished necessary paperwork for damaged assemblies/components to track disposal or repair at depot facility. Was required to perform day to day administrative activities to include keeping track of station operations; tracking work performed on faulty equipment using job tickets; compose/send electronic messages pertaining to the status of the equipment; and writing performance reports on subordinates.

title: Telecommunications Specialist
company: Marine Corps Installations - Pacific DPRI / FRF Program Management Office
description: Responsible for telecommunications planning for Defense Policy Review Initiative (DPRI) and Futenma Replacement Facility (FRF) construction projects. Manages the development and execution of DPRI telecommunication master plans. Performs telecommunications planning, distribution design and requirements analysis for US Marine Corps construction projects in Japan; includes cabling (both fiber optic and copper), cable pathways, telecom spaces, equipment cabinet layout, communication power and grounding systems, Gigabit Passive Optical Networks (GPON), outside plant cable infrastructure, CATV systems and Land Mobile Radio (LMR) systems.

title: Lead Information Technology Specialist
description: Served as the Lead Information Technology (IT) Specialist and IT project manager for the 58th Signal Battalion with the responsibility of planning, designing and coordinating a wide variety of telecommunication projects. I supervised four civilian and one military information technology specialists. Projects included telecom planning and design for MILCON construction of new facilities, to include host nation funded projects, MCA, and Army NETCOM projects. The projects included Defense Information Systems Network (DISN) systems, wideband transmission systems (fiber optic networks, SONET, DWDM and microwave radio), outside plant cable (fiber and copper), horizontal and backbone cabling systems using CAT5e, CAT6 and MM fiber, telecom spaces and military satellite communication systems.

title: Technical Director
description: Managed the operation and maintenance of eighteen telecommunication sites of the Defense Information Systems Network (DISN) consisting of Nortel SONET fiber optics, Cisco routers/switches, NET Promina 800 multiplexers and Alcatel microwave radios (MDR-4205).
